original: khyad par can zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo'i spyi ni khyad par can nyid yin te khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo'i spyi ni khyad par can nyid yin te khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe special‚Äù is the universal of a different nature from that, because it is not devoid of another distinction.

original: rtags ni khyad par gyi mngon sum las de las gzhan ldog pa ni spyi dang 'gal ba can yin par bstan pa ni spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtags ni khyad par gyi mngon sum las de las gzhan ldog pa ni spyi dang 'gal ba can yin par bstan pa ni spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The sign is the exclusion of that from another distinction. The teaching of the universal that is contradictory to that is ‚Äúthe universal is . . .‚Äù

original: gal te khyad par gyi spyi ma grub na de ma yin pa las log pas kyang khyab pa 'dzin pa'i yul ji ltar yin zhes zer ba ni gal te bsgrub bya zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te khyad par gyi spyi ma grub na de ma yin pa las log pas kyang khyab pa 'dzin pa'i yul ji ltar yin zhes zer ba ni gal te bsgrub bya zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIf the universal of the distinction is not established, how can the object of the apprehension of the pervasion be the exclusion of that which is not?‚Äù the response is, ‚ÄúIf the probandum . . .‚Äù

original: khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: khyad par gyis so //
translated: It is a distinction.

original: bsgrub par bya ba yang yin spyi yang yin zhes bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yang yin spyi yang yin zhes bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe probandum is also a universal‚Äù is the response.

original: khyab pa 'dzin pa ni ma'am du ba zhes bya ba ni de ma yin pa las log pa'i shes pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyab pa 'dzin pa ni ma'am du ba zhes bya ba ni de ma yin pa las log pa'i shes pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThe apprehension of the pervasion is smoke‚Äù is the exclusion of that which is not.

original: spyi yin la de'i shugs kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par bsgrub bya yin pa de'i phyir 'gal ba med par bstan pa ni 'di ni bshad zin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi yin la de'i shugs kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par bsgrub bya yin pa de'i phyir 'gal ba med par bstan pa ni 'di ni bshad zin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The general is the probandum, and the particular that follows from it is the probans. Therefore, there is no contradiction. This is what is meant by ‚Äúthis has been explained.‚Äù

original: chos can bcas par zhes bya ba ni chos can thams cad du 'gro ba yid kyis zhen pa tsam yin gyi nges par ston pa'i nges par dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos can bcas par zhes bya ba ni chos can thams cad du 'gro ba yid kyis zhen pa tsam yin gyi nges par ston pa'i nges par dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAlong with the subject‚Äù means that all subjects are merely mental constructs, and that the object of ascertainment of a definitive description is not ascertained.

original: mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pas khyad par du byas pa'i spyi yang bum pa'am sgra la ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pas khyad par du byas pa'i spyi yang bum pa'am sgra la ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the universal that is distinguished by the exclusion of the non-possessor not a non-vase or a non-sound?

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because there is no distinction.

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang 'gal ba dag nyid do zhes zer ba la 'di ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang 'gal ba dag nyid do zhes zer ba la 'di ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the universal is both the pervasion and the contradiction. This is what is meant by ‚Äúthis.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba can med pa'i bsgrub bya nyid kyi khyad par yin gyi khyad par du byas pa ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba can med pa'i bsgrub bya nyid kyi khyad par yin gyi khyad par du byas pa ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The absence of the pervasion is the distinction of the probandum, but the distinguished is not the absence of the pervasion. This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir 'gog pa yin zhes zer ba la de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gog pa yin zhes zer ba la de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is it a negation? It is like that.üîΩThis is what is said.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba 'dod pa smos pas zhes bya ba ni 'grel par ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba 'dod pa smos pas zhes bya ba ni 'grel par ro //
translated: By mentioning ‚Äúthus‚Äù in the commentary, it is said.

original: chos can la chos dang chos can bsdus pa nyid bsdu bya nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos can la chos dang chos can bsdus pa nyid bsdu bya nyid yin no //
translated: The inclusion of the property possessor and the property within the property possessor is the object of inclusion.

original: de gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i khyad par las zlog pa bsgrub pas 'gal ba nyid @238b mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i khyad par las zlog pa bsgrub pas 'gal ba nyid @238b mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to show that there is no contradiction in proving the opposite of the distinction in the nature of both of those,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said ‚Äúhow?‚Äù

original: gnyis las zhes bya ba ni chos can dang de la yod pa'i chos tsam gyi bsgrub bya la'o //
analyzed: gnyis las zhes bya ba ni chos can dang de la yod pa'i chos tsam gyi bsgrub bya la'o //
translated: From the two, the probandum is only the property possessor and the property that exists in it.

original: gcig ni chos can nam chos kyi'o //
analyzed: gcig ni chos can nam chos kyi'o //
translated: One is either the property possessor or the property.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rgol bas dam bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rgol bas dam bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not so, because it is asserted by the opponent.

original: mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa'i sgra ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa'i sgra ma yin te /
translated: The sound of impermanence is not the sound of permanence,

original: byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang chos can nam chos nyid kyis sel bar byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang chos can nam chos nyid kyis sel bar byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: because it is produced. Is this not an exclusion by the property possessor or the property itself?

original: de ci'i phyir de lta bu'i skyon med pa yin zhes zer ba la chos can la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir de lta bu'i skyon med pa yin zhes zer ba la chos can la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith respect to the subject‚Äù is supplied.

original: mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa sgra ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos can nam chos 'ba' zhig sel ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa sgra ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos can nam chos 'ba' zhig sel ba ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsound is not non-sound‚Äù does not merely negate the property of the subject;

original: chos can la 'dod pa ma yin pa de nyid sel ba'i phyir chos can la chos bsgrub bya yin na /
analyzed: chos can la 'dod pa ma yin pa de nyid sel ba'i phyir chos can la chos bsgrub bya yin na /
translated: it also affirms the property of the subject, because it is the very thing that is not asserted with respect to the subject that is being eliminated.

original: tshogs pa ni tshogs pa kho na ma yin zhes bya ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa ni tshogs pa kho na ma yin zhes bya ba'i don yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe collection is not the collection itself‚Äù means that the collection is not the collection itself.

original: chos can la 'dus pa mi 'dod pa'i phyir rgol ba po sel bar byed kyang skyon med pa yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can la 'dus pa mi 'dod pa'i phyir rgol ba po sel bar byed kyang skyon med pa yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the opponent is eliminated because the collection is not asserted with respect to the subject, there is no fault, because there is no difference.

original: bstan bcos su 'dod pa la yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: bstan bcos su 'dod pa la yang 'gyur na /
translated: If it is asserted in the treatise,

original: dogs pa'i gnas dgag pa'i rang nyid kyi sgras ci zhig bya zer ba la /
analyzed: dogs pa'i gnas dgag pa'i rang nyid kyi sgras ci zhig bya zer ba la /
translated: then what is the point of the phrase ‚Äúwith respect to the subject‚Äù?

original: chos can gcig la zhes bya ba ste rgol ba 'dod pa'i chos tsam bsgrub bya yin na /
analyzed: chos can gcig la zhes bya ba ste rgol ba 'dod pa'i chos tsam bsgrub bya yin na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith respect to the subject‚Äù is supplied because if the mere property that is asserted by the opponent is the property to be established,üîΩthen the property to be established would not be the property of the subject.

original: tshogs pa 'dod pa ma yin te tha dad pa'i phyir la chos can la chos gzhan 'dod pa nyid yin na bstan bcos su 'dod pa 'di 'dod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa 'dod pa ma yin te tha dad pa'i phyir la chos can la chos gzhan 'dod pa nyid yin na bstan bcos su 'dod pa 'di 'dod pa kho na yin te /
translated: It is not that the collection is asserted, because they are different. If it were that the property possessor itself is asserted to be another phenomenon, then the treatise would assert this, because it would exist like another phenomenon.

original: chos gzhan bzhin du yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dogs pa 'dod pa smos pas bsal bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ba de bzlog pa'i phyir rang nyid kyi sgra yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos gzhan bzhin du yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dogs pa 'dod pa smos pas bsal bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ba de bzlog pa'i phyir rang nyid kyi sgra yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is for the purpose of countering the doubt that the assertion is not eliminated by the statement of assertion.

original: lung gi dam bca' ba'i don yin pa'i phyir gcig bzhin du gzhan yang 'dod pa smos pas thob pa de rang nyid ces bya bas sel bar byed pa yin pa bshad pa ni kha cig na re zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrnam 'grel ni gsal bar byed pa'i'o //
analyzed: lung gi dam bca' ba'i don yin pa'i phyir gcig bzhin du gzhan yang 'dod pa smos pas thob pa de rang nyid ces bya bas sel bar byed pa yin pa bshad pa ni kha cig na re zhes bya ba'o // rnam 'grel ni gsal bar byed pa'i'o //
translated: Because it is the meaning of the statement of the treatise, the assertion of another is obtained like the one, and that is eliminated by ‚Äúitself.‚ÄùüîΩSome say that the commentary is for the purpose of clarification.

original: bstan bcos su 'dod pa'i rang nyid kyi 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don du smra ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos su 'dod pa'i rang nyid kyi 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don du smra ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the treatise is that it is its own assertion.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid kyang ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid kyang ste /
translated: Moreover, means that space is a quality.

original: mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pas dam bca' ba'i skyon te khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pas dam bca' ba'i skyon te khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: Since impermanence is being established, the thesis is faulty, because it contradicts what is accepted.

original: de lta bur thob pa yin na rang nyid kyi don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bur thob pa yin na rang nyid kyi don bstan pa ni /
translated: If it were obtained in that way, the meaning of one‚Äôs own would be taught.

original: skad cig de ma thag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: skad cig de ma thag ces bya ba ste /
translated: The moment after means

original: rnam pa gnyis ka la yang rten gyi nus med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka la yang rten gyi nus med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that in both cases, the basis is powerless. That is the meaning.

original: 'dzin pa po nam mkha' khas mi len na 'jig par byed pa ma byung gi @239a * //
analyzed: 'dzin pa po nam mkha' khas mi len na 'jig par byed pa ma byung gi @239a * //
translated: If the apprehender is not accepted as space, then the destroyer would not occur.

original: bar du yang rlung gis gshags pas zhig par gyur pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni rlung gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bar du yang rlung gis gshags pas zhig par gyur pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni rlung gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thought that it would be destroyed by the wind‚Äôs friction is the wind.

original: 'jig par byed pa las 'jig pa can ni nam mkha' med kyang nam mkha' med pa nyid las gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa las 'jig pa can ni nam mkha' med kyang nam mkha' med pa nyid las gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The destruction of the destroyer would be space. Even without space, it would remain due to the absence of space. That is the nature.

original: rten gzhan med pa ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rten gzhan med pa ni rnam pa'o //
translated: The absence of another basis is the aspect.

original: skad cig pa du gzhan la gnas pa ma yin pa la rten don med par bstan pa ni /üîΩgal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa du gzhan la gnas pa ma yin pa la rten don med par bstan pa ni / gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The uselessness of a basis for that which does not endure in another moment is taught:üîΩIf it is thought that the nature of sound, etc. is established by scripture, and that it is not to be disputed, then the response is:

original: rten don med pa yin yang sgra la sogs pa'i de nyid kyi rang bzhin lung las grub pa yin la brgal zhing brtag par bya ba nyid ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni de bden zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rten don med pa yin yang sgra la sogs pa'i de nyid kyi rang bzhin lung las grub pa yin la brgal zhing brtag par bya ba nyid ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni de bden zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is true.üîΩThe conclusion is:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: Therefore.

original: gtan tshigs kyi skyon ni bstan bcos su 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya phyin ci log tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos su 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya la gnod pa yin yang rang gi 'dod pa grub pa yin na sgrub byed la skyon med do zhes bya ba'i ched
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi skyon ni bstan bcos su 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya phyin ci log tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos su 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya la gnod pa yin yang rang gi 'dod pa grub pa yin na sgrub byed la skyon med do zhes bya ba'i ched
translated: The fault of the reason is that it proves the opposite of the thesis accepted in the treatise, and so it contradicts the thesis accepted in the treatise. But if one‚Äôs own position is established, there is no fault in the proof.

original: du rang smos pa yin no //
analyzed: du rang smos pa yin no //
translated: For that reason, the author of the commentary states his own position.

original: skyon yin na thal ches pa'i skyon yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skyon yin na thal ches pa'i skyon yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The fault of overextension is taught:

original: gal te bstan bcos khas blangs phyir //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos khas blangs phyir //
translated: If it is thought that the nature of sound, etc. is established by scripture, and that it is not to be disputed, then the response is:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is true.

original: kun bzung bas zhes bya ba ni rgol bas te bstan bcos su 'dod pa'i chos thams cad khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: kun bzung bas zhes bya ba ni rgol bas te bstan bcos su 'dod pa'i chos thams cad khas blangs pas so //
translated: The opponent says, Because all are accepted, because all phenomena that are asserted in the treatise are accepted.

original: de la ni chos kyi phung po la'o //
analyzed: de la ni chos kyi phung po la'o //
translated: In that, in the aggregate of phenomena refers to the aggregate of phenomena.

original: gcig la'ang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la'ang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Also, in one refers to the quality of space, etc.

original: rab tu gnod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i skyon du gal te 'gyur na chos can gzhan la yang ste /
analyzed: rab tu gnod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i skyon du gal te 'gyur na chos can gzhan la yang ste /
translated: If it is an error of the reason, etc. because it is very damaging, then it is also in another subject.

original: dri sa'i yon tan nyid bzlog pa bsgrub pa la yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thal 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri sa'i yon tan nyid bzlog pa bsgrub pa la yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thal 'gyur ro //
translated: It would also be in the proof of the opposite, the quality of earth, etc. This is a reductio.

original: gzhan la'ang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la'ang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la'o //
translated: Also in another refers to the quality of space.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan yin pa la sgra chos can mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa la gnas skabs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan yin pa la sgra chos can mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa la gnas skabs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't sound, the subject, in the proof of impermanence, a quality of space?

original: dri ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni ji ste chos can 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dri ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni ji ste chos can 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thinking, It is not a quality of earth, In this subject is stated.

original: dri sa'i yon tan nyid bzlog pa bsgrub pa la yang bstan bcos kyi don bsgrub pa khas blangs pa'i phyir gnas skabs pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni gal te 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dri sa'i yon tan nyid bzlog pa bsgrub pa la yang bstan bcos kyi don bsgrub pa khas blangs pa'i phyir gnas skabs pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni gal te 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the treatise is established by the reversal of the qualities of the opponent, and so it is shown that the opponent‚Äôs position is only temporary.

original: chos de'i zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos so //üîΩ'dod pa'i chos kyi rten nyid kyis chos can du 'dod pa ni chos dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba ni chos can zhes bya ba ste chos can chos sogs zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i chos @239b can gyi chos yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos de'i zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos so // 'dod pa'i chos kyi rten nyid kyis chos can du 'dod pa ni chos dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba ni chos can zhes bya ba ste chos can chos sogs zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i chos @239b can gyi chos yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the quality of impermanence.üîΩThe opponent‚Äôs position is that the subject is accepted only as the basis of the quality that is accepted, and so the word ‚Äúsubject‚Äù is used. The word ‚Äúsubject‚Äù is used because the subject is the basis of the quality.

original: 'dod pa'i chos bzhin du rgol ba 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chos bzhin du rgol ba 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The opponent accepts the subject and the quality in the same way that he accepts the subject and the property to be proven.

original: chos can 'dod pa yin yang chos can bzhin du des chos thams cad bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: chos can 'dod pa yin yang chos can bzhin du des chos thams cad bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even though the subject is accepted, the opponent does not accept that all qualities of the subject are to be proven in the same way that the subject is.

original: gnas skabs 'ga' yis zhes bya ba ste phyir rgol bas gnas skabs kyis byas pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'ga' yis zhes bya ba ste phyir rgol bas gnas skabs kyis byas pa rnams kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy some circumstances‚Äù means by those created by the opponent.

original: 'dod pa ni rgol ba'i'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni rgol ba'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe desire‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs.

original: rtogs pa yang de dag gi zhes bya ba ni rgol bas gnas skabs su byas pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rtogs pa yang de dag gi zhes bya ba ni rgol bas gnas skabs su byas pa rnams kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe understanding‚Äù is by those created by the opponent.

original: nan gyis zhes bya ba ni de lta bu rtogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir dang gzhan yang lhag ma dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nan gyis zhes bya ba ni de lta bu rtogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir dang gzhan yang lhag ma dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúForcefully‚Äù means that there is no way to make it understood, and also because it has a remainder.

original: go bar byed pa'i tshig gi khyad par gyi gnas skabs kyang go bar byed par brjod do zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i tshig gi khyad par gyi gnas skabs kyang go bar byed par brjod do zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the statement that the circumstances of the words that make it understood are also said to make it understood is:

original: de nyid nus pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te 'dod pa'i chos can gyi chos yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i chos bzhin du rgol ba'i 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid nus pa zhes bya ba'o // gal te 'dod pa'i chos can gyi chos yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i chos bzhin du rgol ba'i 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThat very ability.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir sgrub pa ma yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgrub pa ma yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: If it is a property of the desire because it is a property of the desire, like the property of the desire, then why is it not a proof because of the desire of the opponent?

original: 'bras bu'i rtags can te bsgrub bya las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu nyid rtag pa yin pa las na 'di ni 'bras bu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩyong ba'i phyir skad cig ma nyid yin pa la lung las 'dod pa'i bdag med pa nyid ni gnod par bya ba ma yin par khyed nyid kyang 'dod pa ma yin nam /üîΩde gnod na gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i skyon yin zhes zer ba la med na mi 'byung zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags can te bsgrub bya las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu nyid rtag pa yin pa las na 'di ni 'bras bu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // yong ba'i phyir skad cig ma nyid yin pa la lung las 'dod pa'i bdag med pa nyid ni gnod par bya ba ma yin par khyed nyid kyang 'dod pa ma yin nam / de gnod na gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i skyon yin zhes zer ba la med na mi 'byung zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reason is the effect of the probandum, and the effect itself is different from the probandum.  The meaning is that this is not the effect.

original: bstan bcos su 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa la gnod pa ma yin pa ma yin te /üîΩkhyab par byed pa nyid kyis med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du ni med na mi 'byung ba la nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: gal te lung las 'dod pa nyid kyi bdag med pa nyid la gnod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te lung las 'dod pa nyid kyi bdag med pa nyid la gnod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the scriptures do not contradict the selflessness of the desire realm,

original: de'i rtsa ba tsan gyi skad cig ma nyid du sgrub par 'dod pa ste 'dod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba tsan gyi skad cig ma nyid du sgrub par 'dod pa ste 'dod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: then the root of that, momentariness, is certainly to be established, is certainly to be accepted.

original: rjes dpag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste bshad pa ni /üîΩrjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig //
analyzed: rjes dpag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste bshad pa ni / rjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig //
translated: The response to that is:üîΩThe words are not accepted as valid

original: tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod cing //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod cing //
translated: with regard to the object of inference.

original: 'di la rjes dpag mi 'jug ste //
analyzed: 'di la rjes dpag mi 'jug ste //
translated: Inference does not apply here,

original: yongs brtags yongs su len phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs brtags yongs su len phyir ro //
translated: because it is a complete fabrication, a complete assumption.

original: bya bas so //
analyzed: bya bas so //
translated: The action is the same.

original: yod pa nyid ni skad cig ma nyid la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma las nges pa yin la lung las ni de las shes par 'dod pa tsam yin gyi rjes su dpag par @240a * //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni skad cig ma nyid la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma las nges pa yin la lung las ni de las shes par 'dod pa tsam yin gyi rjes su dpag par @240a * //
translated: The existence of momentariness is ascertained by a valid cognition that contradicts its opposite, but by scripture it is merely accepted as something to be known, not as something to be ascertained by inference.

original: bya ba la nges pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bya ba la nges pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation that it is not to be ascertained is:

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: ‚Äúat that time‚Äù means in the case of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: 'grel pa ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: The commentary is clear.

original: de na de bzhin zhes bya ba ni lha'i mig can no //
analyzed: de na de bzhin zhes bya ba ni lha'i mig can no //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is such a one‚Äù refers to the one who has the divine eye.

original: khyed cag pas zhes bya ba ni khyed cag las kyang gzhan pa ma yin pa ste dman pa ma yin gyi mchog yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyed cag pas zhes bya ba ni khyed cag las kyang gzhan pa ma yin pa ste dman pa ma yin gyi mchog yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúNot inferior to you‚Äù means not inferior to you, not other than you, meaning that he is superior.

original: lung thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad kyis thams cad rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad kyis thams cad rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAll scriptures‚Äù means all scriptures.

original: brtags nas zhes bya ba ni skyes bus byas pa dang cig shos nyid kyang sgra las byung ba la rang nyid kyis don dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags nas zhes bya ba ni skyes bus byas pa dang cig shos nyid kyang sgra las byung ba la rang nyid kyis don dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving examined‚Äù means that the human-made and the non-human-made are both not inherently related to the meaning that arises from sound.

original: des na lung dang lung 'gal ba tshad ma nye bar ldang ba khas mi len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na lung dang lung 'gal ba tshad ma nye bar ldang ba khas mi len pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of not accepting the arising of valid cognition that contradicts scripture,

original: shes par 'dod pa ldang ba'i ched du lung khas blangs nas rjes su dpag pa'i dus su 'dor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa ldang ba'i ched du lung khas blangs nas rjes su dpag pa'i dus su 'dor ba'i phyir /
translated: having accepted scripture for the purpose of generating the desire to know, when inferring, one should abandon it.

original: des khas blangs pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid 'dor bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: des khas blangs pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid 'dor bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the inference accepted by him would be abandoned.

original: de che rtsod dor zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de che rtsod dor zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúabandoning the dispute.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus na nges par byed pa'i phyir khas len pa dang 'dor ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus na nges par byed pa'i phyir khas len pa dang 'dor ba yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the case that one accepts or rejects it at the time of inference, because one ascertains it.üîΩAnd it is contradictory to accept that it arises at the time one wishes to know it.

original: shes par 'dod pa'i dus na ni de ldang bar byed pa nyid du khas len pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa'i dus na ni de ldang bar byed pa nyid du khas len pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: This is the system of the Jains.

original: shes par 'dod pa ldang bar byed pas tshad ma ldang bar byas nas khas blangs pa'i yul du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa ldang bar byed pas tshad ma ldang bar byas nas khas blangs pa'i yul du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation that the object is accepted after the valid knowledge that makes it arise is generated is as follows.

original: 'di ni khas len thabs yin te //
analyzed: 'di ni khas len thabs yin te //
translated: This is the method of acceptance.

original: zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: This is inference.

original: khas len pa ni nye bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: khas len pa ni nye bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Acceptance is the desire to approach.

original: de'i tshe yang shes par 'dod pa ldang bas rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yang yod pa'i rjes su 'jug bzhin pa yang don dang 'brel pa med pas nges par byed pa ma yin pas yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang shes par 'dod pa ldang bas rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yang yod pa'i rjes su 'jug bzhin pa yang don dang 'brel pa med pas nges par byed pa ma yin pas yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, since the desire to know arises, even if it exists at the time of inference, since it is engaged in the present, it is not ascertained because it is not related to the object, and it is not a part because it is not ascertained.

original: rjes su dpag pa khas len pa'i thabs ma yin nam nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la yang yod pa kho na yin la mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa khas len pa'i thabs ma yin nam nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la yang yod pa kho na yin la mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba la /
translated: But is not the quality of space accepted as a logical reason?

original: de ltar yul gnyis zhes bya ba ste de ltar te 'gal ba med pas so //
analyzed: de ltar yul gnyis zhes bya ba ste de ltar te 'gal ba med pas so //
translated: The response is, It is not, because it is contradictory.

original: yul gnyis ni dngos su dang rjes su dpag pa'i med na mi 'byung ba'i yul bdag med pa bzhin du khas len pa'i dus yin la /
analyzed: yul gnyis ni dngos su dang rjes su dpag pa'i med na mi 'byung ba'i yul bdag med pa bzhin du khas len pa'i dus yin la /
translated: The two objects are the direct and the indirect objects. The time when the two objects are accepted is when the non-existence of the self is accepted as the object of direct perception and inference.

original: de'i tshe ni gnod pa khas len pa na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni gnod pa khas len pa na'o //
translated: At that time, the contradiction is accepted.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ni med na mi 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ni med na mi 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The quality of space is not the non-existence of impermanence,

original: mi rtag pa nyid dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: because it contradicts impermanence. This is the opponent's position.

original: 'grel par ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'grel par ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: In the commentary, it is clear.

original: de'i tshe yang don la nges pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar gnod pa yin zhes zer ba la de dang @240b ni 'gal bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang don la nges pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar gnod pa yin zhes zer ba la de dang @240b ni 'gal bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: At that time, because there is no certainty about the meaning, how is there a contradiction? The response is, It is contradictory to that.

original: gal te nges pa med pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir dus phyis bzhin du yul rnam par dag pa'i dus na yang ci'i phyir bstan bcos 'dzin pa ma yin zhes zer ba la gnas gsum par ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te nges pa med pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir dus phyis bzhin du yul rnam par dag pa'i dus na yang ci'i phyir bstan bcos 'dzin pa ma yin zhes zer ba la gnas gsum par ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If, because there is no certainty, there is no difference, then why, like later, is one not a holder of the treatises at the time of the pure object?

original: de grub par tshad ma las rtogs nas de'i thob par bya ba yin pa rtogs pa'i don du lung khas len pa yin gyi de'i thob pa nyid la ni ma yin te don med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de grub par tshad ma las rtogs nas de'i thob par bya ba yin pa rtogs pa'i don du lung khas len pa yin gyi de'i thob pa nyid la ni ma yin te don med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, having understood the proof by means of a valid cognition, one accepts scripture for the purpose of understanding the object to be attained, but not for the attainment itself, because that would be pointless.

original: brtags nas zhes bya ba ni yul gnyis la'o //
analyzed: brtags nas zhes bya ba ni yul gnyis la'o //
translated: Having investigated means with regard to the two objects.

original: de dang ste khas len pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i lung dang 'gal ba yin pa nges te sems pa ni rgol ba po 'di'i yongs su rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dang ste khas len pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i lung dang 'gal ba yin pa nges te sems pa ni rgol ba po 'di'i yongs su rtogs pa ste /
translated: At the time of accepting that, there is a contradiction with the scripture that arises, because the thought of this opponent is the full understanding.

original: slar yang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: slar yang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Again is supplied.

original: rnam par dpyod pa ni dus ring ba nyid kyis bstan bcos 'dzin pa nyid kyi dus las 'das pas ma dpyad par ji ltar yang rung zhes bya bas khas blangs pa yang de nyid kyi tshe gnod par byed pa ma yin te khas len pa'i dus la ltos
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa ni dus ring ba nyid kyis bstan bcos 'dzin pa nyid kyi dus las 'das pas ma dpyad par ji ltar yang rung zhes bya bas khas blangs pa yang de nyid kyi tshe gnod par byed pa ma yin te khas len pa'i dus la ltos
translated: Since analysis takes a long time, it would be past the time for memorizing the treatise. Therefore, since it is said that it is suitable to do anything without analysis, the assertion is not undermined at that time.üîΩ

original: pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi don to //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAnalysis‚Äù means that since the time of the treatise is long past, the time of the treatise‚Äôs retention has passed. Therefore, ‚Äúwhatever is suitable‚Äù is accepted. At that time, it is not harmed, because it depends on the time of acceptance. This is the meaning of the context.

original: lung las grub pa'i chos kyi chos can bde ba rab tu ster ba las phyin ci log pa la lung gis gnod pa ni chos bzhin du de'i bdag nyid kyi bsgrub bya la yang de tshad ma nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: lung las grub pa'i chos kyi chos can bde ba rab tu ster ba las phyin ci log pa la lung gis gnod pa ni chos bzhin du de'i bdag nyid kyi bsgrub bya la yang de tshad ma nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The subject that is established by scripture, which grants supreme bliss, is harmed by scripture with respect to the opposite. Like the subject, the probandum that is of its nature is also valid cognition.

original: rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa'i bdag nyid la yang 'gal ba ma yin par bstan pa ni der yang zhes bya ba ste lung gi gnod pa la'o //
analyzed: rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa'i bdag nyid la yang 'gal ba ma yin par bstan pa ni der yang zhes bya ba ste lung gi gnod pa la'o //
translated: The teaching that it is not contradictory with respect to the nature of substance, quality, and so on is ‚Äúthere‚Äù with respect to the harm of scripture.

original: med na mi 'byung la zhes bya ba ni lung gis grub pa de'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung la zhes bya ba ni lung gis grub pa de'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-arising without‚Äù is established by scripture, and it is of its nature.

original: gzhan min te zhes bya ba ni rdzas ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan min te zhes bya ba ni rdzas ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot other‚Äù refers to non-substance, etc.

original: lung gis gnod pa yin du zin kyang 'brel pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas gnod pa yang de nyid kyi spang bya yin par bstan pa ni der yang zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: lung gis gnod pa yin du zin kyang 'brel pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas gnod pa yang de nyid kyi spang bya yin par bstan pa ni der yang zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: Even if there is contradiction with scripture, contradiction with a related inference, etc. is also to be avoided. ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas gnod par te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas gnod par te /
translated: contradiction with an inference, etc.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la bdag med pa nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la bdag med pa nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, impermanence is to non-self.

original: gzhan min zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa 'brel pa can ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan min zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa 'brel pa can ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot other‚Äù refers to non-space-qua-quality, etc. which are unrelated.

original: 'grel par nye bar bsdu ba'i don bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'grel par nye bar bsdu ba'i don bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the summary in the commentary is

original: 'di gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: 'di gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: with the words ‚Äúthis is the position.‚Äù

original: med na mi 'byung min don la //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung min don la //
translated: ‚ÄúNot being a non-apprehension of the object‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i sgrub byed kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgrub byed kyis so //
translated: is the proof.

original: bdag med pa'i chos rnams dang / dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa rnams //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i chos rnams dang / dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa rnams //
translated: The dharmas of non-self and the cognitions without an object

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lung la ma grub pa'i chos can la ni bdag dang bcas pa nyid dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa lung @241a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lung la ma grub pa'i chos can la ni bdag dang bcas pa nyid dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa lung @241a * //
translated: the understanding from scripture of the self and the possessed of an object, etc., is not a sublation of the related.üîΩThe statement that it is not a sublation of the related is ‚Äúin all investigations.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement that it is not a sublation of the related is ‚Äúin all investigations.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement that it is not a sublation of the related is ‚Äúin all investigations.‚Äù

original: las rtogs pa ni 'brel pa can la gnod par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni dpyod kun la zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdngos su 'brel pas sam don la des pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: las rtogs pa ni 'brel pa can la gnod par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni dpyod kun la zhes bya ba'o // dngos su 'brel pas sam don la des pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: The statement that it is not a sublation of the related is ‚Äúin all investigations.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement that it is not a sublation of the related is ‚Äúin all investigations.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement that it is not a sublation of the related is ‚Äúin all investigations.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement that it is not a sublation of the related is ‚Äúin all investigations.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement that it is not a sublation of the related is ‚Äúin all investigations.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos khas blangs pa yin yang de'i don gcig rjes su 'gro ba yod na lhag ma de'i don gzhan la rjes su 'gro ba rnyed dka' ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ma grub na de la nges pa'i mi rtag pa nyid mi 'grub po zhes bya bar /

analyzed: med na mi 'byung min don la //

original: zhes bya bas lan btab zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas lan btab zin to //

original: khyab pa la khyad par med kyang nam mkha'i yon tan nyid sgrub par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: khyab pa la khyad par med kyang nam mkha'i yon tan nyid sgrub par byed pa ma yin na /

analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du sgrub par mi 'gyur ro zhes de sel bar byed pa ni 'brel med ces bya ba'o //

analyzed: khyad par bya ba nyid kyis 'brel pa can de bsgrub pa'i ched du mngon sum la sogs pas grub pa'i chos can gyi chos can nyid dang / gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba bstan par bya ba ma yin na bstan bcos la grub pa rnams dang ni smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan pa ni chos can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the subject itself, which is established by perception and so on, and the presence of the reason are not taught for the purpose of establishing the related subject by the action of the distinction, then what need is there to mention the established in the treatise? This is taught by the word ‚Äúsubject.‚Äù

original: me mi 'grub pa ni ma yin la zhes bya ba ni rang gi don la'o //
analyzed: me mi 'grub pa ni ma yin la zhes bya ba ni rang gi don la'o //

analyzed: bstan par bya bas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don la'o //

original: chos can gyi chos blangs pa med na grub mtha' la gnod pa ma yin gyi nam mkha'i yon tan nyid nyams pa yin na /
analyzed: chos can gyi chos blangs pa med na grub mtha' la gnod pa ma yin gyi nam mkha'i yon tan nyid nyams pa yin na /
translated: If the quality of the subject is not accepted, there is no harm to the conclusion, but if the quality of space is lost,

analyzed: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir grub mtha' la gnod pa yin par bstan pa ni mi 'khrul pas na zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: rang bzhin ni gtan tshigs kyi khyab byed do //

analyzed: don ni khyab bya'o 'bras bu la yang mi 'khrul bas te gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas grub pa'i nges pas so //
translated: Since the effect is also non-erroneous, it is established by the valid cognition that harms.

original: ngo bo nyid las @242a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las @242a * //
translated: From the nature

original: zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa'i ngo bo las te smra ba ni 'dod pas byas pa don gyi ngo bo ma yin pa bzlog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa'i ngo bo las te smra ba ni 'dod pas byas pa don gyi ngo bo ma yin pa bzlog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means from the nature of the understood. Since speech is done by desire, it is the opposite of the nature of the meaning. This is the meaning.

original: nges pa'i don la yang rang bzhin gyis go byed yin yang bstan bcos dang ldan pa ni khas blangs pas gnod pa'i 'jigs pas de las rtogs par byed pa ma yin zhes zer ba la de ni 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i don la yang rang bzhin gyis go byed yin yang bstan bcos dang ldan pa ni khas blangs pas gnod pa'i 'jigs pas de las rtogs par byed pa ma yin zhes zer ba la de ni 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Even in the definitive meaning, although the nature is the understood, since the treatise is accepted, there is the fear of being harmed. Therefore, it is not understood from that.

original: chos can la bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi don rtogs pa kho na bsgrub bya rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rtogs par mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos can la bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi don rtogs pa kho na bsgrub bya rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rtogs par mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the probandum is not present in the subject, then the understanding of the meaning of the invariable concomitance is the understanding of the probandum. How can it not be understood?

original: 'gal ba can de de ltar shes kyang brjod na rgol ba skyon can nyid yin no zhes zer ba la gtan tshigs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba can de de ltar shes kyang brjod na rgol ba skyon can nyid yin no zhes zer ba la gtan tshigs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one states the contradictory, even though one knows it in that way, one is a faulty debater.

original: tshig gi nus pas gnod pa yin na rgol ba'i skyon can du 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ni ma yin te ma brjod kyang de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshig gi nus pas gnod pa yin na rgol ba'i skyon can du 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ni ma yin te ma brjod kyang de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the fault is due to the power of the words, then the debater would be at fault. But that is not the case, because even if it is not stated, it is the nature of the thing. That is the meaning.

original: de'i rang bzhin brjod na don bzhin du rgol ba po ni tshig gis rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar 'brel pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba ni gnod byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin brjod na don bzhin du rgol ba po ni tshig gis rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar 'brel pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba ni gnod byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: If one states its nature, then just like the meaning, the debater is only connected with a contradiction of his assertion, because he follows the words. That is what is meant by the refutation.

original: ma brjod pa'i sgrub byed la yang gnod par byed pa yin na tshig 'di lhan cig byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma brjod pa'i sgrub byed la yang gnod par byed pa yin na tshig 'di lhan cig byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the reason is not stated, it is also a fault. The meaning of the statement ‚Äúthis word is not a co-operating factor‚Äù is as follows.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the opponent.

original: dngos su'am lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis kyang nges pa ste /
analyzed: dngos su'am lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis kyang nges pa ste /
translated: It is certain that the word is not a co-operating factor either directly or indirectly.

original: mi rigs pa byed pa min na skyon can du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi rigs pa byed pa min na skyon can du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it does not perform an improper function, it is not faulty.

original: gtan tshigs bzhin du ltar snang ba la yang rang nyid kyi skyon yod na de dag gi tshig dag la 'dod pa dang cig shos grub pa'i rgyu nyid du khyad par che ba yin par bstan pa ni gtan tshigs ltar snang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bzhin du ltar snang ba la yang rang nyid kyi skyon yod na de dag gi tshig dag la 'dod pa dang cig shos grub pa'i rgyu nyid du khyad par che ba yin par bstan pa ni gtan tshigs ltar snang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is a fault in the reason and the pseudo-reason, there is a great difference in the words of those two in being the cause of establishing the desired and the undesired. This is shown by ‚Äúpseudo-reason.‚Äù

original: 'dir ma yin zhes bya ba ni byas pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ma yin zhes bya ba ni byas pa nyid la'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúnot‚Äù refers to the probandum, ‚Äúbeing produced.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba'i 'dod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid de rang gi 'dod pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i 'dod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid de rang gi 'dod pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the desired impermanence. It is a means of establishing one‚Äôs desired probandum because it is stated as a part of the proof.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid rtsod pa'i gzhi yin pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid rtsod pa'i gzhi yin pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the context in which impermanence is the subject of dispute.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni byas pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni byas pa nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this case‚Äù refers to the fact that it is produced.

original: ma brjod pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi don nam mkha'i yon tan nyid sgrub byed de /
analyzed: ma brjod pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi don nam mkha'i yon tan nyid sgrub byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúNot stated‚Äù refers to the fact that the thesis of the treatise is established by the quality of space.

original: ma yin te sgrub par byed pa yang zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi don mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma yin te sgrub par byed pa yang zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi don mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúNot so‚Äù refers to the thesis of the treatise, impermanence.

original: 'dir mi rtag pa nyid bstan bcos kyi don dang 'gal ba can ni mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa'i phyir 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa yin yang dug dang 'dres pa'i kha zas bzhin du @242b mi 'dod pa kho na ma yin nam zhes zer ba la gal
analyzed: 'dir mi rtag pa nyid bstan bcos kyi don dang 'gal ba can ni mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa'i phyir 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa yin yang dug dang 'dres pa'i kha zas bzhin du @242b mi 'dod pa kho na ma yin nam zhes zer ba la gal
translated: Here, someone might say, ‚ÄúImpermanence, which is contrary to the thesis of the treatise, is not desired, because it is mixed with the undesired. Even though it establishes the desired, it is not desired, like food mixed with poison.‚Äù

original: te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the response.

original: rigs min bas zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba can no //
analyzed: rigs min bas zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba can no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable‚Äù means it is contrary.

original: rigs pa smra ba yang zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa yang bsgrub bya nyid du smra ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa smra ba yang zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa yang bsgrub bya nyid du smra ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe proponent of reason‚Äù means the proponent of the pervasion.

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni 'gog byed ces bya ba'i 'dren par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni 'gog byed ces bya ba'i 'dren par byed pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is a conjunction.

original: bstan bcos ma lus pa'i don gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba ma yin te de ste 'gal ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos ma lus pa'i don gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba ma yin te de ste 'gal ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the entire treatise is not contradicted by reasoning, because there is no contradiction.

original: 'ga' zhig la yang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la yang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement that there is no contradiction for anyone is the ‚Äúconnection.‚Äù

original: yul tha dad pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no contradiction because the objects are different.

original: me la sogs pa'i sgrub byed thams cad kyang me ma yin pa dgag pa la sogs pa mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa'i phyir /
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i sgrub byed thams cad kyang me ma yin pa dgag pa la sogs pa mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa'i phyir /
translated: All proofs of fire, etc., are not proofs because they are mixed with the undesired, such as the negation of non-fire.

original: sgrub byed ma yin pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la don kun zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgrub byed ma yin pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la don kun zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúall objects‚Äù means

original: bzlog pa dgag par mi byed na 'khrul pa yin par sgrub byed ma yin pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzlog pa dgag par mi byed na 'khrul pa yin par sgrub byed ma yin pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that if the negation is not reversed, it is not a proof, but rather a non-proof.

original: kun du ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dag la'o //
analyzed: kun du ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEverywhere‚Äù means in the world and in treatises.

original: me ni me ma yin par mngon sum gyis bkag pa de'i phyir 'gal ba can ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: me ni me ma yin par mngon sum gyis bkag pa de'i phyir 'gal ba can ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Fire is not non-fire, because it is directly perceived. Therefore, it is not contradictory.üîΩIf the quality of space is established by scripture, it is contradictory, like the non-erroneous contradiction.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ni lung las grub pa yin na 'gal ba can yin te 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa lta bu'o zhes zer ba la chos can gcig la zhes bya ba ste sde phan tshun du'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ni lung las grub pa yin na 'gal ba can yin te 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa lta bu'o zhes zer ba la chos can gcig la zhes bya ba ste sde phan tshun du'o //
translated: Here, the two qualities of space are established by scripture and inference, respectively.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dag tshad ma'i rtsa ba can gyi mi rtag pa nyid kyis cig shos la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dag tshad ma'i rtsa ba can gyi mi rtag pa nyid kyis cig shos la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the quality of space and impermanence are established by the root of valid cognition. Because impermanence contradicts the other,üîΩSince there is no natural connection, how can they be equal in strength?

original: rang bzhin gyi 'brel pa med pa'i phyir stobs mtshungs pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi 'brel pa med pa'i phyir stobs mtshungs pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Both are established by the root of valid cognition.

original: sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub bya rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub bya rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The proof is that which causes the understanding of what is to be proven.

original: nyams 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'gal ba can gyi tshig mthong ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las kyang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'gal ba can gyi tshig mthong ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las kyang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúaspect‚Äù is seen to be contradictory in all cases, and it is possible to infer that.

original: de la ni bstan bcos la'o //
analyzed: de la ni bstan bcos la'o //
translated: In that case, it is in the treatise.

original: yod par byed pa ni grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yod par byed pa ni grub par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMaking it exist‚Äù means making it established.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid kho na mi rtag pa nyid dang 'gal ba yin gyi de'i med pa dang ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid kho na mi rtag pa nyid dang 'gal ba yin gyi de'i med pa dang ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is shown that the quality of space itself is contradictory to impermanence, not its nonexistence.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid med pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid med pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The nonexistence of the quality of space

original: de med pa dang 'gal ba med na de nyid 'grub pa yin gyi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de med pa dang 'gal ba med na de nyid 'grub pa yin gyi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If that nonexistence were not contradictory, then that itself would be established, not permanence, etc.

original: mi rtag pa nyid dang nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dag gi phan tshun 'gal ba dang cig shos kyi gnas skabs yin la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dang nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dag gi phan tshun 'gal ba dang cig shos kyi gnas skabs yin la /

analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgrub byed la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i don yin no //

original: bsgrub bya gang yang rung ba bsgrub pa na bstan bcos kyi don gang yang rung ba gnod pa'i phyir yang skyon du 'gyur ba bstan pa ni thams cad thams cad kyi gnod 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: thams cad ni bstan bcos te 'brel pa can ma yin pa'o //

original: thams cad kyi ni rtags kyi'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi ni rtags kyi'o //
translated: ‚Äú Any‚Äù refers to the reason.

original: gnod pa ni rtags thams cad kyi bstan bcos gnod pa'i phyir thams cad kyi zhes bya ba gtan tshigs la gnod pa yin no zhes zer ba 'brel pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //

translated: The statement ‚Äúthere is no connection‚Äù is by the Jaina.

original: 'brel pa med kyang gnod pa yin na thal ches pa ni 'di la ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med kyang gnod pa yin na thal ches pa ni 'di la ma yin te /
translated: If there is a fault even without a connection, then there is an overextension of the argument.

original: de yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni 'brel pas te yod pa zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni 'brel pas te yod pa zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it exists‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúexistence.‚Äù

original: ci las shes na des na ste mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyus so //
analyzed: ci las shes na des na ste mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyus so //
translated: If it is asked what is known, then it is known by that, by the cause of impermanence.

original: de nyid ni chos can la ste bstan bcos kyi don nam mkha'i yon tan de nyid gnod par 'gyur ba de'i phyir skyon yin no zhes bya ba ni bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni chos can la ste bstan bcos kyi don nam mkha'i yon tan de nyid gnod par 'gyur ba de'i phyir skyon yin no zhes bya ba ni bsams pa'o //
translated: That itself is the subject, the meaning of the treatise, the quality of space. That itself is faulty. The fault is because of that. This is the thought.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rgol ba bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rgol ba bzlog pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúno‚Äù is the refutation of the opponent.

original: chos can de la yang rang gi bsgrub bya nyid dang 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs yin gyi nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa gzhan dang ni ma yin par bstan pa ni gtan tshigs zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgnas @243b pa ma yin yang mi rtag pa nyid la bdag med pa nyid bzhin du 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir 'di med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir rigs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: chos can de la yang rang gi bsgrub bya nyid dang 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs yin gyi nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa gzhan dang ni ma yin par bstan pa ni gtan tshigs zhes bya ba'o // gnas @243b pa ma yin yang mi rtag pa nyid la bdag med pa nyid bzhin du 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir 'di med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir rigs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason is related to the property to be established in that very subject, not to something else, such as the quality of space. This is indicated by the word reason.

original: med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste mi rtag pa nyid la bdag med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste mi rtag pa nyid la bdag med pa lta bu'o //
translated: Even though it is not a locus, impermanence is related to selflessness, like impermanence is related to selflessness. Therefore, it is reasonable to say that if this is absent, that is absent. This is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthe absence of one entails the absence of the other,‚Äù like impermanence entails selflessness.

original: de ni 'dir zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid dang nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid dang nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la'o //
translated: This is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúin this case,‚Äù which refers to impermanence and the quality of space.

original: bstan bcos gnod pa 'ba' zhig ni gzhan ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: bstan bcos gnod pa 'ba' zhig ni gzhan ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The treatise states that the reason is not merely a contradiction,

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid des byas pa yang de la'am sa la yang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid des byas pa yang de la'am sa la yang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: because the production of something upon the mere exertion of effort is the same for that reason as it is for earth.

original: khyab par byed pa bstan pa 'di de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa bstan pa 'di de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúin this case,‚Äù which refers to the reason.

original: rgol ba'i 'dod pa las bstan bcos gzhan gyi 'dod pa bsal bar bya ba'i ched du rang gi smos pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rgol ba'i 'dod pa las bstan bcos gzhan gyi 'dod pa bsal bar bya ba'i ched du rang gi smos pa ma yin na /
translated: If the treatise were not stated for the purpose of refuting the opponent's thesis,

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i tshig dam bca' ba yin pa'i phyir de yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon du 'gyur bas bstan pa ni gal te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i tshig dam bca' ba yin pa'i phyir de yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon du 'gyur bas bstan pa ni gal te /
translated: then the words unproven reason and so on would be a thesis, and that would be a fault of the reason. Therefore, it is stated:

original: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the treatise is accepted.

original: rgol ba rang gi sgo nas gzhan gyi 'dod pa las kyang khyad par med par bstan pa ni gzhan gyi yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgol ba rang gi sgo nas gzhan gyi 'dod pa las kyang khyad par med par bstan pa ni gzhan gyi yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other's shows that there is no difference from the opponent's thesis even from the opponent's own point of view.

original: dam bca' ba ni lung yin par zhes bya ba sgrub pa ma yin pa'o zhes zer ba ni lung ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba ni lung yin par zhes bya ba sgrub pa ma yin pa'o zhes zer ba ni lung ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thesis is not a proof, because it is scripture means it is not scripture.

original: dam bca' ba nyid lung yin no zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba yin zhes zer ba ni lung zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dam bca' ba nyid lung yin no zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba yin zhes zer ba ni lung zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The thesis is scripture means it is to be proven.

original: ma grub pa la sogs pa'i tshig dam bca' ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma grub pa la sogs pa'i tshig dam bca' ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The words 'unproven' and so on are not a thesis means it is not the case.

original: lung nyid dam bca' ba ma yin no bar bshad zin to zhes zer ba ni ma yin te dam bca' ba ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrang gi 'dod pa la skyon sel bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: lung nyid dam bca' ba ma yin no bar bshad zin to zhes zer ba ni ma yin te dam bca' ba ni zhes bya ba'o // rang gi 'dod pa la skyon sel bar byed pa ni /
translated: The statement it is not a thesis is not correct, because it is said that a thesis is....

original: de ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The removal of faults in one's own assertion is as follows: This is true....

original: bstan bcos kyi don nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni sgrub byed kyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyang khyad par gyis bzlog par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni sgrub byed kyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyang khyad par gyis bzlog par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The reason for the meaning of the treatise is as follows: The probandum of the proof is also not to be refuted by the qualifier,

original: thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gal te sgrub byed nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gal te sgrub byed nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: because it is too much. This is taught in If the proof itself....

original: bstan bcos kyi don rjes su brjod nas rgol ba'i 'dod pa bsgrub bya yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid rigs pa ma yin nam /üîΩde lta yin na rang gi don kho na bsgrub bya yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don rjes su brjod nas rgol ba'i 'dod pa bsgrub bya yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid rigs pa ma yin nam / de lta yin na rang gi don kho na bsgrub bya yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Having restated the meaning of the treatise, is it not reasonable to establish the opponent's assertion as the probandum?

original: gal te mi 'dod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mi 'dod ces bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, it is taught that only one's own purpose is the probandum: If it is not accepted....

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ni brten pa la sogs pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir rang bzhin ba dang don rtogs par byed pa nyid ni rgan po rnams kyi tha snyad las yi ge snga ma 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yi ge maüîΩgtogs pa de'i tha snyad gzhan du mi 'thad pas rgan po rnams kyis de ltar shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ni brten pa la sogs pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir rang bzhin ba dang don rtogs par byed pa nyid ni rgan po rnams kyi tha snyad las yi ge snga ma 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yi ge ma gtogs pa de'i tha snyad gzhan du mi 'thad pas rgan po rnams kyis de ltar shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is illogical that the qualities of space are dependent and so on, the prior syllables are not apprehended by the direct perception that apprehends the meaning.

original: gzhan @244a * //üîΩyin pa dang mthong ba nyid du zhen pa'i sgra las sor mo'i brda lta bur brda ji lta ba bzhin du don dran pa'i phyir /üîΩdran pa po gzhan dang shes pa yang nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan @244a * // yin pa dang mthong ba nyid du zhen pa'i sgra las sor mo'i brda lta bur brda ji lta ba bzhin du don dran pa'i phyir / dran pa po gzhan dang shes pa yang nges pa yin te /
translated: Since it is untenable to designate anything else as the meaning of the syllables, the elderly know it in that way.üîΩSince the meaning is remembered in accordance with the sign, like the sign of the finger, the one who remembers and the consciousness are also ascertained.

original: dran pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa la sogs pa dang 'dres pa'i phyir gzhan skyes bus byas pa dang / tshad ma nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: dran pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa la sogs pa dang 'dres pa'i phyir gzhan skyes bus byas pa dang / tshad ma nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: Since it is mixed with desire and so on, just as it is remembered, it is also a valid knowledge.

original: gnod pas zhes bya ba ni de lta bu la sogs pa la mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgrub byed kyis so //
analyzed: gnod pas zhes bya ba ni de lta bu la sogs pa la mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgrub byed kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy a fault‚Äù means by a proof of impermanence such as that.

original: nyes pa can ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa can ni rgol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe faulty one‚Äù is the opponent.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the reply.

original: rang nyid ni 'dod pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang nyid ni 'dod pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own‚Äù is to be supplied as ‚Äúdesire.‚Äù

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir ni de dang 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir ni de dang 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of that‚Äù means because of the connection with that.

original: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni sgra dang sgra gzhan las skyes pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni sgra dang sgra gzhan las skyes pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that sound is produced from another sound.

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i gnas nyid du'o //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i gnas nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means in the place of manifestation.

original: gsal bar byed pa'am skyed par byed pa yang rna ba'i yul du sgra gsal por byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'am skyed par byed pa yang rna ba'i yul du sgra gsal por byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The manifestation or production of sound does not manifest sound as the object of the ear.

original: dpag tshad ces bya ba ni gsal ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ma khyab na 'jug pa nyid ni yan lag med pa nyid du mi rigs te yon tan rnams brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpag tshad ces bya ba ni gsal ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ma khyab na 'jug pa nyid ni yan lag med pa nyid du mi rigs te yon tan rnams brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúA yojana‚Äù is a particular manifestation. If it is not pervasive, it is not tenable that it is without parts, because qualities are supported.

original: dri yang sa la zhes bya ba ni gcig tu dbyer med par ma rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dri yang sa la zhes bya ba ni gcig tu dbyer med par ma rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And smell is earth. This is because it is not understood to be indivisible.

original: gzhan du 'das pa ni rlung gi rdzas kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan du 'das pa ni rlung gi rdzas kyis so //
translated: Otherwise, the past is by the substance of wind.

original: yon tan dang ni sgra dang sa yin pa'i phyir ni rdzas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan dang ni sgra dang sa yin pa'i phyir ni rdzas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the qualities, sound, and earth, it is a substance.

original: de zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
translated: That is sound.

original: de dmigs kyang ni dri dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dmigs kyang ni dri dmigs pa'o //
translated: Even though that is perceived, smell is perceived.

original: lhan cig tu zhes bya ba ni sa dang ngo //
analyzed: lhan cig tu zhes bya ba ni sa dang ngo //
translated: Together means with earth.

original: bya ba dang bcas pa nyid ma yin na yon tan nyid kho na do ra bar bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bya ba dang bcas pa nyid ma yin na yon tan nyid kho na do ra bar bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If it is not just activity, the very quality is to be established.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If, it is said.

original: nang gi rlung rna ba'i phyogs su song bas khyab pa'i sgra gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes pa 'dis bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: nang gi rlung rna ba'i phyogs su song bas khyab pa'i sgra gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes pa 'dis bsal ba yin te /
translated: The internal wind going to the ear region clarifies the sound that pervades it. This is the clarification.

original: skye ba'i yul la dmigs pas sgra nyid 'da' bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i yul la dmigs pas sgra nyid 'da' bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Sound itself is to be transcended by observing the place of origin.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rang gi 'dod pa la 'da' bar bya ba nyid la sogs pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rang gi 'dod pa la 'da' bar bya ba nyid la sogs pa med par bstan to //
translated: Moreover, indicates that there is no such thing as the transcendence of one's own desires, etc.

original: yon tan la ni yon tan nyid las so //
analyzed: yon tan la ni yon tan nyid las so //
translated: The quality of the quality itself.

original: gzhan gyi yang skad cig re re zhing yul gzhan dang gzhan la 'dra ba skyed par 'dod pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yang skad cig re re zhing yul gzhan dang gzhan la 'dra ba skyed par 'dod pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The fact that the other is also held to generate a likeness in each instant in another place is indicated by:

original: chu rlung sa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chu rlung sa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: water, wind, earth,

original: rgyal dpog pa rnams ni gsal bar byed pa'i rlung dang gzugs la sogs pa nyid kyis rdzas zhes bya bar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyal dpog pa rnams ni gsal bar byed pa'i rlung dang gzugs la sogs pa nyid kyis rdzas zhes bya bar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas maintain that the substance called sound is generated by the conjunction of the self, the internal organ, and the throat, etc.

original: rang gi 'dod pa bstan pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa bstan pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, indicates the statement of their own opinion.

original: gegs byed ni lus can no //
analyzed: gegs byed ni lus can no //
translated: The obstruction is by embodied beings.

original: bral bas ni med pas byas pa'o //
analyzed: bral bas ni med pas byas pa'o //
translated: The separation is by non-existence.

original: bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa'i don du brtags @244b pas sgra la sogs pa'i gzhi nyid grub pa'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa don las thob pa ma yin par bstan pa ni 'on te khyab dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa'i don du brtags @244b pas sgra la sogs pa'i gzhi nyid grub pa'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa don las thob pa ma yin par bstan pa ni 'on te khyab dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since the basis of sound, etc. is established by the imagination of what is desired by the self, space, etc. are not established as objects, as indicated by:üîΩor by pervasion.

original: de 'dra ba'i bdag nyid ni de'i bya ba byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bdag nyid ni de'i bya ba byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Such a nature is due to its performance of the action.

original: nam mkha'i ci byar yod ces bya ba ni de yang de'i bya ba dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i ci byar yod ces bya ba ni de yang de'i bya ba dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: What could space do? It would not even be connected with the action.

original: de rnams kyis te phyogs rnams kyi shar nyid la sogs pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis te phyogs rnams kyi shar nyid la sogs pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The directions are the divisions of east, etc.

original: bu ga med par byed ba med pa na pug la de ltar te nam mkhar ro //
analyzed: bu ga med par byed ba med pa na pug la de ltar te nam mkhar ro //
translated: In the absence of a hole, there is no making of a hole, and so with space.

original: bu ga med par byed pa ste mthar thug par byed pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: bu ga med par byed pa ste mthar thug par byed pa yod pa'o //
translated: There is the making of a hole, i.e., the completion of a hole.

original: de med na yang ni dmigs pa med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de med na yang ni dmigs pa med pa yang ngo //
translated: In the absence of that, i.e., in the absence of an objective support,

original: de dang zhes bya ba mthar thug pa la'o //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba mthar thug pa la'o //
translated: in that, i.e., in the completion,

original: gzhan na ni gzhan na'o //
analyzed: gzhan na ni gzhan na'o //
translated: in another, i.e., in another place,

original: de nyid na ni mthar thug pa na'o //
analyzed: de nyid na ni mthar thug pa na'o //
translated: in that very place, i.e., in the completion,

original: 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bu ga yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bu ga yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is a contradiction, because space is a hole.

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni dbyig pa la sogs pa las so //üîΩde zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni dbyig pa la sogs pa las so // de zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: From what? From a stick, etc.üîΩThat, i.e., a pot, etc.

original: de med de dbyig pa la sogs pa med pa na'o //
analyzed: de med de dbyig pa la sogs pa med pa na'o //
translated: In the absence of that, i.e., in the absence of a stick, etc.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to a pot, etc.

original: de min ni nye bar gnod pa'o //
analyzed: de min ni nye bar gnod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot that‚Äù refers to the absence of the pot, etc.

original: bltad  pa ni dmigs pa med kyang tha snyad byed pa'o //
analyzed: bltad  pa ni dmigs pa med kyang tha snyad byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPerception‚Äù refers to the designation of an object even though it does not exist.

original: tshad ma ni med do zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ni med do zhes sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúValidity‚Äù is not.

original: gzhan pa las ma yin zhes bya ba ni khyab pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan pa las ma yin zhes bya ba ni khyab pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúNot from another‚Äù refers to the absence of pervasion.

original: 'gro ba ni shar la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni shar la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDirection‚Äù refers to east, etc.

original: de med pa ni nub la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni nub la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAbsence of that‚Äù refers to the absence of west, etc.

original: gzhan du ni phyogs gzhan du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni phyogs gzhan du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúElsewhere‚Äù refers to another direction.

original: gnas pa ni gsal bar byed pa'i mi shar la sogs pa med na rang las de mngon par gsal ba ni phyogs las kyang mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /üîΩgnas skabs las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni gsal bar byed pa'i mi shar la sogs pa med na rang las de mngon par gsal ba ni phyogs las kyang mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni / gnas skabs las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding‚Äù refers to the manifestation of the pot, etc. If east, etc. do not exist, then the manifestation of that from itself would not occur even in the direction.üîΩ‚ÄúFrom the state‚Äù refers to the manifestation of the pot, etc.

original: 'gyur ba ni phyogs las zhes bya bar sbyar ba'am tha snyad du 'gyur ba ni yod pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni phyogs las zhes bya bar sbyar ba'am tha snyad du 'gyur ba ni yod pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom change‚Äù refers to the manifestation of the pot, etc. from the direction.

original: rang gi ngo bor zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du yid kyis rtogs pa na'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du yid kyis rtogs pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom one‚Äôs own nature‚Äù refers to the mental understanding of the pot, etc. as if they were form, etc.

original: gang la ni grong la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gang la ni grong la sogs pa la'o //
