translated: In what? In villages, etc.üîΩAnd in time, which is the cause of the manifestation of the nature of the past, etc.

original: dus la yang 'das pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i gsal bar byed pa kho nar nges pa'i dngos po ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin par bstan pa ni byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: dus la yang 'das pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i gsal bar byed pa kho nar nges pa'i dngos po ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin par bstan pa ni byung bar gyur to //
translated: The object of the convention of the past, etc. is taught to be the entity which is ascertained as the cause of manifestation.

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used.

original: rgyal po gang dag ces bya ba ni r'a ma na la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po gang dag ces bya ba ni r'a ma na la sogs pa'o //
translated: The kings are RƒÅma, etc.

original: so sor nges pa ni so sor nges pa can no //
analyzed: so sor nges pa ni so sor nges pa can no //
translated: The specific is that which has a specific.

original: 'gog pa ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'thob pa med pa dang gnang ba med pa'o //üîΩdus kyis 'byung ba smin byed cing //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'thob pa med pa dang gnang ba med pa'o // dus kyis 'byung ba smin byed cing //
translated: The cessation is the non-acquisition and non-attainment of the nature of an entity.üîΩTime brings about the ripening

original: dus kyis skye dgu sdud par byed //
analyzed: dus kyis skye dgu sdud par byed //
translated: and time brings about the destruction of beings.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: smin pa ni skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: smin pa ni skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: ripening is the production.

original: 'dod pa las ni bdag las so //üîΩgzhan du ni dus @245a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa las ni bdag las so // gzhan du ni dus @245a * //
translated: From desire, from oneself.

original: la sogs pa tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: la sogs pa tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: In another way, time, etc. are different.

original: 'di ni nam mkha' nyid du zhes bya ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nam mkha' nyid du zhes bya ni rgol ba'o //
translated: This is the objection: ‚ÄúIt is just space.‚Äù

original: de'i ni 'bar ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ni 'bar ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The burning, etc. of that.

original: mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni rten las gzhan du mthong bar ro //
analyzed: mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni rten las gzhan du mthong bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe same‚Äù means that it is seen as different from the basis.

original: gal te 'dod pa smos pa kho na las bstan bcos su 'dod pa las ldog pa yin na phyogs kyi mtshan nyid rdzogs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa smos pa kho na las bstan bcos su 'dod pa las ldog pa yin na phyogs kyi mtshan nyid rdzogs pa yin zhing /
translated: If the treatise is a reversal of what is stated in the statement ‚Äúfrom desire,‚Äù then the definition of a position is complete.

original: rang nyid ces bya ba don med de bzlog par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni phyogs mtshan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba don med de bzlog par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni phyogs mtshan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is meaningless because there is nothing to be reversed.

original: bstan bcos su 'dod pa thams cad bsgrub bya nyid yin pa'i phyogs la rang nyid ces bya ba don med par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos su 'dod pa thams cad bsgrub bya nyid yin pa'i phyogs la rang nyid ces bya ba don med par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on the statement ‚Äúin the position where all that is stated in the treatise is the probandum, the word ‚Äòitself‚Äô is meaningless‚Äù is as follows.

original: rang nyid kyi sgra ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi sgra ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is the word ‚Äúitself.‚Äù

original: de yang / gal te mi 'dod sgrub min na //
analyzed: de yang / gal te mi 'dod sgrub min na //
translated: And if it is not accepted, it is not established.

original: zhes bya ba lan yin na ji ltar yin zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lan yin na ji ltar yin zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: If this is the reply, then how is it? This is the opponent‚Äôs rejoinder.

original: bstan bcos su 'dod pa la rang gi 'dod pas khas len pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos su 'dod pa la rang gi 'dod pas khas len pa ma yin gyi /
translated: In the treatise, desire is not accepted by one‚Äôs own assertion.

original: 'o na ci zhe na khyad par can gyi yang dag par 'dod pa nyid kyis yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na khyad par can gyi yang dag par 'dod pa nyid kyis yin te /
translated: But if it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù it is the assertion of the special, because

original: skyes bu ma byas pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i don du rang nyid kyi tshig yin par bstan pa ni gal te bstan bcos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu ma byas pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i don du rang nyid kyi tshig yin par bstan pa ni gal te bstan bcos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is not produced by a person. In order to dispel that doubt, the meaning of the statement ‚Äúit is one‚Äôs own words‚Äù is taught.

original: yod pa la sogs pas mi rtag pa nyid yin na skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir tshad mas rjes su bzung ba'i bstan bcos khas blang ba byas pa'i khyad par can nyid yin na /
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pas mi rtag pa nyid yin na skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir tshad mas rjes su bzung ba'i bstan bcos khas blang ba byas pa'i khyad par can nyid yin na /
translated: If impermanence is established by existence and so on, then because it is impossible that it is not produced by a person and so on, it is a special assertion that a treatise is accepted as being established by valid knowledge.

original: ji ltar 'dod pas 'jug pa dang cig shos yin zhes dogs par byed ces bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pas 'jug pa dang cig shos yin zhes dogs par byed ces bstan pa ni /
translated: If that is so, then it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is it engaged by desire and the opposite?‚Äù

original: 'o na dogs 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na dogs 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis doubt‚Äù teaches that.

original: tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'jug pa de med na mi 'byung bar bstan pa ni gal te tshad mas bkag na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'jug pa de med na mi 'byung bar bstan pa ni gal te tshad mas bkag na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIf it is refuted by valid knowledge‚Äù teaches that the engagement by the reason of valid knowledge does not occur without it.

original: tshig las ni byed pas so //
analyzed: tshig las ni byed pas so //
translated: From the words, it is by the agent.

original: gang gis rgol ba ste rtog pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa yang tshad ma'i rtsa ba can nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis rgol ba ste rtog pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa yang tshad ma'i rtsa ba can nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even the assertions of the opponent, i.e., the one who has doubts, are based on valid cognitions.

original: cig shos kyang 'dod pa tsam du khas blangs pa de bzhin du khas blangs pa yin na /
analyzed: cig shos kyang 'dod pa tsam du khas blangs pa de bzhin du khas blangs pa yin na /
translated: If the other party accepts that it is merely an assertion, then it is accepted that it is just an assertion.

original: gzhan yang de kho na bzhin du khas len par 'gyur te de ltar 'jug pa grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de dag sngar yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrgol ba'i 'dod pa yin yang tshad ma yod pa dad cig shos dag nyid kyis 'dzin pa dang cig shos dag yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de kho na bzhin du khas len par 'gyur te de ltar 'jug pa grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de dag sngar yang zhes bya ba'o // rgol ba'i 'dod pa yin yang tshad ma yod pa dad cig shos dag nyid kyis 'dzin pa dang cig shos dag yin na /
translated: Moreover, it would be just as if one were to accept it as it is, because it is established that it is just as it is. This is indicated by the words ‚Äúeven before.‚Äù

original: rang nyid kyi tshig gis ci zhig bya zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi tshig gis ci zhig bya zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Even if it is the assertion of the opponent, if the existence of valid cognitions is accepted by both parties, then what is the use of one‚Äôs own words?

original: de ltar na 'o na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is said by ‚ÄúIf that is so . . .‚Äù

original: rang nyid ces bya bas bstan bcos su 'dod pa bzlog pas kyang bsgrub bya 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya bas bstan bcos su 'dod pa bzlog pas kyang bsgrub bya 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúone‚Äôs own‚Äù indicates that even if the assertion is refuted in the treatise, the probandum is established.

original: ma bzlog kyang 'thob pa'i don yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: ma bzlog kyang 'thob pa'i don yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: If one says that the meaning is that it is obtained even if it is not refuted,üîΩ.

original: @245b gal te mi gnod do zhen zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @245b gal te mi gnod do zhen zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt does not harm,‚Äù then that is it.üîΩIsn‚Äôt it just the desire to refute desire that is taught in the treatise? Why is it that he himself mentions it?

original: mi 'dod pa nyid kho nas bstan bcos su 'dod pa bzlog pa ma yin nam ci'i phyir rang nyid smos pa yin snyam du sems pa la rnam par bcad pa'i don du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa nyid kho nas bstan bcos su 'dod pa bzlog pa ma yin nam ci'i phyir rang nyid smos pa yin snyam du sems pa la rnam par bcad pa'i don du ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not for the sake of exclusion,

original: log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don nyid dogs pa'i gnas bkag pas zhes bya bas bkag zin to //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don nyid dogs pa'i gnas bkag pas zhes bya bas bkag zin to //
translated: but rather for the sake of dispelling misunderstanding. The point has already been refuted by the statement, ‚ÄúThe point of refuting the locus of doubt.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir dgos pa ci zhig yod ces zer ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgos pa ci zhig yod ces zer ba la /
translated: Therefore, what is the purpose of this?

original: log par rtogs pa zhes bya ba rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa zhes bya ba rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmisunderstanding‚Äù is a repetition.

original: 'dod gnod med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'bras bu bsgrub bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod gnod med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'bras bu bsgrub bya ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdesire is not harmed‚Äù and so on is the conclusion.

original: 'dod pa mi rtag pa nyid la gnod pa med pa ste 'gal ba med pa'i phyir la 'gal ba med pa yang de med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis so//
analyzed: 'dod pa mi rtag pa nyid la gnod pa med pa ste 'gal ba med pa'i phyir la 'gal ba med pa yang de med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis so//
translated: Desire is not harmed by impermanence because there is no contradiction. The absence of contradiction is because the absence of desire is not the case.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos su 'dod pa ma yin pa'i'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos su 'dod pa ma yin pa'i'o //
translated: Because it is not to be established, desire is not taught in the treatise.

original: bsgrub bya ma yin na nyid la yang yin na thug pa med pa ni gtan tshigs thams cad kyi 'bras bu'i nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya ma yin na nyid la yang yin na thug pa med pa ni gtan tshigs thams cad kyi 'bras bu'i nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: If it is not the probandum, then there is an infinite regress. This is the result of all the reasons.

original: gal te sgra mi rtag ces bya ba'i chos can ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: gal te sgra mi rtag ces bya ba'i chos can ji lta bu yin /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is the subject in the statement ‚ÄòSound is impermanent‚Äô?‚Äù

original: ma grub pa'i chos can la ni sgrub byed ma yin la gzhung lugs kyi khyad par gyis byas pa'i chos can la grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i chos can la ni sgrub byed ma yin la gzhung lugs kyi khyad par gyis byas pa'i chos can la grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If the subject is not established, then it is not the probandum. If the subject is established, then it is the probandum.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / yon tan gsum mam 'di skyes bu'am //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yon tan gsum mam 'di skyes bu'am //
translated: The three qualities, or this person,

original: yang na nam mkha'i yon tan nam //
analyzed: yang na nam mkha'i yon tan nam //
translated: or the quality of space,

original: yi ge las gzhan na de'i bdag / rlung gi yon tan byed min na //
analyzed: yi ge las gzhan na de'i bdag / rlung gi yon tan byed min na //
translated: if the self of sound is not made from the quality of wind,

original: tshig dang ngag gi bdag bsal ba'am //
analyzed: tshig dang ngag gi bdag bsal ba'am //
translated: then the self of speech and words is refuted.

original: rang bdag nyid las ma bzlog pa//üîΩ'di rnams mi rtag 'gyur mod kyang //
analyzed: rang bdag nyid las ma bzlog pa// 'di rnams mi rtag 'gyur mod kyang //
translated: The self is not refuted from itself.üîΩThese are impermanent,

original: ded la de rnams mi rtag min //
analyzed: ded la de rnams mi rtag min //
translated: but in reality they are not impermanent.üîΩThe reason is not established,

original: khyad par nyid ni ma grub dang // gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs nyid //
analyzed: khyad par nyid ni ma grub dang // gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs nyid //
translated: and the basis is not established.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la de bsal ba'i ched du rab tu grub pa'i chos can yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir rang nyid smos pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni / gzhung lugs kyis byas khyad par dag
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la de bsal ba'i ched du rab tu grub pa'i chos can yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir rang nyid smos pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni / gzhung lugs kyis byas khyad par dag
translated: One might think, There would be faults such as those. In order to dispel that, in order to understand the property-possessor that is well established, he himself states:

original: / ces bya'o //
analyzed: / ces bya'o //
translated: The particular that is made by the textual system.

original: rab tu grags pa sgra zhes bya ba sgras brjod par bya ba sgra nyid kyi spyi rtag pa rtag pa kho na ma yin nam / ji ltar / mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub bya min //
analyzed: rab tu grags pa sgra zhes bya ba sgras brjod par bya ba sgra nyid kyi spyi rtag pa rtag pa kho na ma yin nam / ji ltar / mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub bya min //
translated: Isn't the so-called sound that is well known, the object of expression by sound, the universal of sound, permanent, and permanent alone? How is it that impermanence is not the object of attainment?

original: spyi ni 'di la gang cung zad //
analyzed: spyi ni 'di la gang cung zad //
translated: The universal is that which is partially

original: thams cad kyis ni rtag par brtags //
analyzed: thams cad kyis ni rtag par brtags //
translated: all is imagined by all.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this,

original: rigs kyi sgra gsal ba rnams kyi rjod byed ma yin te gsal ba rnams ni sgra zhes bya ba'i sgra gsal bar byed par mi nus te /
analyzed: rigs kyi sgra gsal ba rnams kyi rjod byed ma yin te gsal ba rnams ni sgra zhes bya ba'i sgra gsal bar byed par mi nus te /
translated: the term type is not the expresser of the manifestations, because the manifestations cannot manifest the sound called sound.

original: rigs kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i khyad par rna bas 'dzin pa ni chos can yin te gzhung lugs thams cad du ma spangs pa rab tu grags pa brjod pa dngos po la brten pa rnam par @246a * //üîΩdpyod pa ni dngos po ma yin pa brda las byung ba rang nyid kyis mi 'gyur pa 'di la 'bad pas ci zhig bya zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rigs kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i khyad par rna bas 'dzin pa ni chos can yin te gzhung lugs thams cad du ma spangs pa rab tu grags pa brjod pa dngos po la brten pa rnam par @246a * // dpyod pa ni dngos po ma yin pa brda las byung ba rang nyid kyis mi 'gyur pa 'di la 'bad pas ci zhig bya zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The difference indicated by the reason, apprehended by the ear, is the subject, because it is well known in all the textual systems, and is expressed without being abandoned.

original: dpyod pa nyid kyi skabs kyis na //
analyzed: dpyod pa nyid kyi skabs kyis na //
translated: The analysis of the thing that is based on the thing is not a thing, but arises from a sign, and does not change by itself. What is the use of striving after this?

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is taught by the verse:üîΩBy the occasion of the analysis itself,

original: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sgrub byed ni dpyod pa yin la /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sgrub byed ni dpyod pa yin la /
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it is produced‚Äù is the analysis.

original: 'dod pa sgrub pa'i ched du sbyar ba ni nang gi sgrub pa la tshad mas grub pa'i chos can 'phen par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa sgrub pa'i ched du sbyar ba ni nang gi sgrub pa la tshad mas grub pa'i chos can 'phen par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The application for the sake of establishing the thesis is called ‚Äúprojecting the subject that is established by a valid cognition in the inner proof.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos gcig gi go bya la mngon par 'dod pa'i dgos pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos gcig gi go bya la mngon par 'dod pa'i dgos pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that there is no purpose that is desired in the understanding of a single treatise is:

original: rang 'dod brtags pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang 'dod brtags pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The imagined one‚Äôs own desire.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i chos can nyid du sgrub par byed par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i chos can nyid du sgrub par byed par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If you maintain that the subject is established in that way,

original: rgol ba ni rang gi don gyi sgrub byed brjod par mi byed par bstan pa ni nyan po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgol ba ni rang gi don gyi sgrub byed brjod par mi byed par bstan pa ni nyan po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the opponent says that the proponent does not state a proof for his own position.

original: 'dod med phyir ni don du gnyer ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod med phyir ni don du gnyer ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no desire‚Äù means because there is no interest.

original: byas pa nyid las kyang brda las byung ba de grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byas pa nyid las kyang brda las byung ba de grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not established that that which arises from a sign is produced from being produced,

original: khyad par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de yas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de yas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because there is no difference maker.

original: gal te grub pa nyid kho na ston pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i sgo nas chos can ma grub pa yang bsgrub bya nyid yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gal te grub pa nyid kho na ston pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i sgo nas chos can ma grub pa yang bsgrub bya nyid yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: If you say that it is not that only what is established is taught, but rather that by means of that, the unestablished subject is also the object to be established,

original: ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then what is the point?

original: de ni ma grub pa'i ngo bo bzlog pa'i tshig nyid kyis 'grub par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ni ma grub pa'i ngo bo bzlog pa'i tshig nyid kyis 'grub par bstan pa ni /
translated: That is taught to be established by the very words that negate the nature of nonestablishment.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIts own nature‚Äù is the nature of the subject.

original: rnam par gcad par bya ba med na khyad par med par bstan pa ni grub pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par gcad par bya ba med na khyad par med par bstan pa ni grub pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement that if there is no object of exclusion, there is no distinction is ‚Äúestablished‚Äù and so on.

original: grub pa'i ngo bos ni chos can ma grub pa yis te /
analyzed: grub pa'i ngo bos ni chos can ma grub pa yis te /
translated: By the nature of being established, the subject is not established.

original: grub pa ni dpyod pa'i gnas skabs nyid na grub pa nyid bzhin du grub par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa ni dpyod pa'i gnas skabs nyid na grub pa nyid bzhin du grub par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is established is not to be established, just as it is established in the very context of analysis.

original: ma grub pa'i chos can grub par bya ba nyid gsal ba'i ched du rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya bas zhar la grub pa'i chos bsgrub bya nyid yin pa yang sel bar byed do zhes bshad pa ni ma grub pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i chos can grub par bya ba nyid gsal ba'i ched du rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya bas zhar la grub pa'i chos bsgrub bya nyid yin pa yang sel bar byed do zhes bshad pa ni ma grub pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to clarify that the subject that is not established is to be established, the additional point that the established property is not to be established is eliminated by ‚Äúby its own nature.‚Äù This is explained in ‚Äúnot established.‚Äù

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid kyi khyad par gyi chos chos can gang gi yin pa grub pa de'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid kyi khyad par gyi chos chos can gang gi yin pa grub pa de'o //
translated: That which is established as the subject that has the property of being a quality of space.

original: chos can gyi khyad par nyid du zhes 'don pa la ni chos can la khyad par nyid kyis ma grub pa'i chos chos can gyi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par nyid du zhes 'don pa la ni chos can la khyad par nyid kyis ma grub pa'i chos chos can gyi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In the reading ‚Äúas the distinction of the subject itself,‚Äù the property that is not established by the distinction of the subject is connected as ‚Äúof the subject.‚Äù

original: sgra mtshungs kyang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan gyi sgra mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: sgra mtshungs kyang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan gyi sgra mi rtag pa'o //
translated: The phrase although the terms are the same means that the term impermanent is a quality of sound.

original: bsgrub bya'i chos khyad par du byed pa ni sgra la sogs pa'i chos can rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /üîΩrjes su dpag pa ni de'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i chos khyad par du byed pa ni sgra la sogs pa'i chos can rang gi mtshan nyid yin la / rjes su dpag pa ni de'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: The phrase the property to be established is distinguished means that the property of the subject, such as sound, is its own characteristic.

original: dpe dang thun mong ba'i spyi la 'jug par brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe dang thun mong ba'i spyi la 'jug par brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Inference is not the subject of that, because it is said to engage a universal that is common to the example and the subject. This is what is meant by the phrase inference is . . ..

original: de'i phyir @246b 'dir ni phyogs kyi mtshan nyid la rang gis zhes bya bas chos can ma grub pa'am cig shos bsgrub bya nyid du ma brjod kyang bsgrub bya nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin par bstan pa ni phyogs la 'gal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir @246b 'dir ni phyogs kyi mtshan nyid la rang gis zhes bya bas chos can ma grub pa'am cig shos bsgrub bya nyid du ma brjod kyang bsgrub bya nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin par bstan pa ni phyogs la 'gal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, in this context, although the word own in the definition of a subject does not explicitly state that the subject is either not established or is the thesis, the phrase contradictory in regard to the subject indicates that it is not the case that the subject is not established or is the thesis. This is what is meant by the phrase contradictory in regard to the subject is . . ..

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na de ma yin pa'i ngo bo las log pas spyi ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na de ma yin pa'i ngo bo las log pas spyi ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't a universal just that which is the opposite of a particular?

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la gal te chos can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la gal te chos can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If someone says, How can it be that which is not the domain of inference? [the response is:] The subject is not established for one party.

original: chos can ni chos can gzhan la med pa'i can phyir gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni rtags rjes 'gro med phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can ni chos can gzhan la med pa'i can phyir gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni rtags rjes 'gro med phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If someone says, The subject is not established for the other party because the subject does not exist in another subject, the reason would not be concomitant, [the response is:] Because there is no concomitance of the reason.

original: rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin pa nyid ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon yin gyi phyogs kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin pa nyid ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon yin gyi phyogs kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: Non-concomitance is a fault of the reason, not of the position.

original: de'i mtshan nyid la skyon de spang bar bya ba yin par bstan pa ni 'di de dag gi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid la skyon de spang bar bya ba yin par bstan pa ni 'di de dag gi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: To show that this fault should be avoided in the definition, it is said: these [faults] of them.

original: de dag ni gtan tshigs dang dpe dag gi ste rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang / bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de dag ni gtan tshigs dang dpe dag gi ste rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang / bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: These are the faults of the reason and example, which have the nature of non-concomitance and incompleteness of the probandum.

original: gtan tshigs la sogs zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la sogs zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The etc. of reason, etc. refers to unestablished [reasons] and so on.

original: phyogs tsam la yod pa nyid kyis thun mong ba yin par bstan pa ni mngon sum la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs tsam la yod pa nyid kyis thun mong ba yin par bstan pa ni mngon sum la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commonality is shown by the mere presence of the position, with the words ‚Äúdirect perception, etc.‚Äù

original: 'on te dper na zhes bya bas sgrub byed la 'os pa nyid phyogs kyi yon tan nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'on te dper na zhes bya bas sgrub byed la 'os pa nyid phyogs kyi yon tan nyid du bstan to //
translated: Or, the suitability for the proof is shown as a quality of the position, with the words ‚Äúfor example.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs kyi skyon zhes bya ba ni phyogs skyon can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi skyon zhes bya ba ni phyogs skyon can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fault of the reason is because the position is not faulty.

original: gzhan gyis ni byas pa nyid la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni byas pa nyid la sogs pas so //
translated: The other is by the reason of being produced, etc.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni chos can la'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni chos can la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the subject.

original: mngon sum gyis grub pa la sgrub pa nyid phyogs kyi skyon nyid ma yin nam zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub pa la sgrub pa nyid phyogs kyi skyon nyid ma yin nam zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Is the very proof of what is established by direct perception not a fault of the position? This is shown by the words

original: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyi skyon ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyi skyon ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe fault of the very proof of what is established.‚Äù

original: lung las grub pa la rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin te ma grub pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: lung las grub pa la rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin te ma grub pa'i phyir la /
translated: In what is established by scripture, there is no pervasion, because it is not established.

original: mngon sum las ni thun mong ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni lung gis grub pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum las ni thun mong ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni lung gis grub pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In what is established by direct perception, there is no commonality. This is what is called ‚Äúestablished by scripture.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin des zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin des zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that nature‚Äù means by a particular.

original: de zhes bya ni spyi'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ni spyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means by a universal.

original: gsal ba mngon sum gang gi yul yin pa mngon sum de gang la yod pa de la rjes su dpag pa ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsal ba mngon sum gang gi yul yin pa mngon sum de gang la yod pa de la rjes su dpag pa ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That which is the object of a manifest perception is a perception. That which has that is not an inference.

original: der zhes bya ba ni khyad par ma yin pa'i bdag nyid mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyis ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni khyad par ma yin pa'i bdag nyid mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyis ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù means that the nature of a particular is established by perception itself and is not established by the nature of a universal.

original: khyad par la dbye ba med pas spyi'i yul can rjes su dpag pa yin yang khyad par gyi yul can shugs kyis yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par la dbye ba med pas spyi'i yul can rjes su dpag pa yin yang khyad par gyi yul can shugs kyis yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since there is no division in a particular, although an inference has a universal as its object, it is taught that it has a particular as its object by implication.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o //üîΩde ltar yin na rang gi mngon sum rang gi @247a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o // de ltar yin na rang gi mngon sum rang gi @247a * //
translated: ‚ÄúBy its own characteristic‚Äù is said.

original: mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul gyi nges pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul gyi nges pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: If that is so, how is the object ascertained by ‚Äúone‚Äôs own perception has its own characteristic as its object,‚Äù and so on?

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy inference‚Äù is said.

original: rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa'i khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa'i khyad par med pa'o //
translated: Realization is without the distinctions of object, etc.

original: gang ste tshad ma'i yul yin pa de ni yul gang yin pa de'i'o //
analyzed: gang ste tshad ma'i yul yin pa de ni yul gang yin pa de'i'o //
translated: That which is the object of a valid cognition is the object of that valid cognition.

original: de nyid kyi sgo nas ni yul can gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi sgo nas ni yul can gyi sgo nas so //
translated: By that very means is by the means of the subject.

original: de yul dang mi 'gal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de yul dang mi 'gal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the non-contradiction of that with the object is

original: de dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because there is no contradiction with that.

original: gzhan ni dgag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni dgag par byed pa'o //
translated: The other is the refutation.

original: de tsam dang 'brel pa phyogs kyi skyon yin gyi gzhan min zhes bya ba ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: de tsam dang 'brel pa phyogs kyi skyon yin gyi gzhan min zhes bya ba ji ltar yin te /
translated: How is it that the fault of the position is only connected with that much, not with anything else?

original: de rnams spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin no snyam du sems pa la rgyu sogs zhes bya ba ste gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyis gzhan dag bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin no snyam du sems pa la rgyu sogs zhes bya ba ste gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyis gzhan dag bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that others are excluded by the characteristics of reason, etc., thinking that they are not to be abandoned.

original: gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis skyon bsal ba'i phyogs la gtan tshigs 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis skyon bsal ba'i phyogs la gtan tshigs 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the position where the fault is excluded by the characteristics of reason, etc., the reason is applied.

original: ci'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel pa sel bar byed ces zer ba la ma khyab dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel pa sel bar byed ces zer ba la ma khyab dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He says, ‚Äúnonpervasion.‚Äù

original: de ma spangs na phyogs nyid mi 'thob ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ma spangs na phyogs nyid mi 'thob ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If that is not abandoned, the position itself is not obtained.

original: gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang ma grub pa'i chos can sgrub par byed pa na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang ma grub pa'i chos can sgrub par byed pa na /
translated: When proving a subject that is not established by the characteristics of the reason, etc.,

original: rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin pa nyid spangs pas de'i don du rang nyid smos pa ni ma khyab pa dang / khyab ches pa dag la dgos pa med pa ni don med pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin pa nyid spangs pas de'i don du rang nyid smos pa ni ma khyab pa dang / khyab ches pa dag la dgos pa med pa ni don med pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la /
translated: by abandoning nonpervasion, the purpose of stating oneself is to avoid nonpervasion and overpervasion.

original: 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚Äúnot so.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid kyi ni phyogs kyi ste gzhan nyid kyis spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi ni phyogs kyi ste gzhan nyid kyis spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The position of the characteristic is abandoned by otherness.

original: de tsam nyid ces bya ba ni rang nyid kyi tshig dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: de tsam nyid ces bya ba ni rang nyid kyi tshig dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúJust that‚Äù means being free from one‚Äôs own words.

original: gzhan gyis ni rang nyid smos pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni rang nyid smos pas so //
translated: By stating oneself, others are included.

original: de ltar na khyab ches pa sel ba ni rang nyid ces bya bas bstan bcos su 'dod pa dang nges su gzung bas ma grub pa sgrub byed nyid du brjod pa dang / rang gi ngo bo zhes bya bas chos can nyid du grub pa dang tshad mas bsal ba ni ma bsal ba'i tshig gis ji skad bstan pa'i skyon rnam par gcod pa'i phyir /üîΩma khyab pa sel bar byed pa'i 'dod pa smos pas rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩrang nyid tshig phrad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na khyab ches pa sel ba ni rang nyid ces bya bas bstan bcos su 'dod pa dang nges su gzung bas ma grub pa sgrub byed nyid du brjod pa dang / rang gi ngo bo zhes bya bas chos can nyid du grub pa dang tshad mas bsal ba ni ma bsal ba'i tshig gis ji skad bstan pa'i skyon rnam par gcod pa'i phyir / ma khyab pa sel bar byed pa'i 'dod pa smos pas rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni / rang nyid tshig phrad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúitself‚Äù in the treatise indicates the elimination of overextension, the word ‚Äúascertained‚Äù indicates the elimination of the nonestablished as a proof, and the word ‚Äúown nature‚Äù indicates the elimination of the established as a subject. The word ‚Äúunproven‚Äù eliminates the fault that has been taught.

original: ldog pa ni khyab ches pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa ni khyab ches pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù indicates the elimination of noncomprehension.üîΩThe word ‚Äúitself‚Äù indicates the elimination of overextension.

original: gzhan gyis ci dgos zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i rnam par bcad par bya ba rnam par gcod par byed pas so //üîΩrnam par gcod par mi byed pa la bstan @247b pa'i skyon dran par byed pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ci dgos zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i rnam par bcad par bya ba rnam par gcod par byed pas so // rnam par gcod par mi byed pa la bstan @247b pa'i skyon dran par byed pa ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúother‚Äù indicates the elimination of the object of exclusion of the reason, etc.üîΩThe word ‚Äúitself‚Äù indicates the elimination of the nonexclusion of the object of exclusion.

original: gal te rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù indicates the elimination of the nonexclusion of the object of exclusion.

original: tshig gis sgros pa lhur len pa la mtshan nyid bstan nas mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tshig gis sgros pa lhur len pa la mtshan nyid bstan nas mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba la bstan pa ni /
translated: Having taught the definition to those who delight in the elaboration of words, he teaches to those who delight in conciseness:

original: bsgrub par khas blangs zhes bya ba ste bsgrub bya min gyi bsgrub bya min pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par khas blangs zhes bya ba ste bsgrub bya min gyi bsgrub bya min pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The statement one who accepts the probandum is not a non-probandum, but a probandum.

original: tshad ma dag gis khyab pa dang de'i ngo bor ma yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa dang khyad par nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba med par grub pa'i chos can dang / sgrub byed nyid du brjod pa dang / bstan bcos su 'dod pa dang khas len pa pos khas ma blangs kyang 'phangs pa la khas len pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma dag gis khyab pa dang de'i ngo bor ma yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa dang khyad par nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba med par grub pa'i chos can dang / sgrub byed nyid du brjod pa dang / bstan bcos su 'dod pa dang khas len pa pos khas ma blangs kyang 'phangs pa la khas len pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of being pervaded by valid cognitions and not being their nature, the non-established subject is established as lacking concomitance by virtue of its distinction, and the statement as the proof, and the thesis accepted by the proponent, even if not accepted in the treatise, are not accepted in the proposition.

original: dngos su rnam par gcad pa'i phyir de ltar ni mi rigs na ci'i phyir de yongs su shes pa la 'bad pa mi byed ces bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: dngos su rnam par gcad pa'i phyir de ltar ni mi rigs na ci'i phyir de yongs su shes pa la 'bad pa mi byed ces bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: If it is not reasonable in that way because of the explicit exclusion, why does one not strive to understand it? This is the opponent's.

original: bsgrub bya khas blangs pa zhes bya ba la bsgrub bya nyid du zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyi 'brel pa ni 'bras bu med pa yin te bsgrub bya bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan ni dngos su ba'i 'brel pa la de ltar rten pa ma yin
analyzed: bsgrub bya khas blangs pa zhes bya ba la bsgrub bya nyid du zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyi 'brel pa ni 'bras bu med pa yin te bsgrub bya bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan ni dngos su ba'i 'brel pa la de ltar rten pa ma yin
translated: The relation of the term to be established is meaningless, because this phrase to be established is not directly related to the word taught.

original: te / bstan bcos kyi 'dod pa thams cad bsgrub bya nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / bstan bcos kyi 'dod pa thams cad bsgrub bya nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because all of the assertions of the treatise are accepted as being to be established.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: Here refers to the commentary.

original: 'dir ci zhig bsgrub ces bya ba ni rgol ba'o //üîΩsngar nyid ces bya ba ni rang nyid tshig phrad ces bya bas sam /
analyzed: 'dir ci zhig bsgrub ces bya ba ni rgol ba'o // sngar nyid ces bya ba ni rang nyid tshig phrad ces bya bas sam /
translated: What is to be established here? is the objection.

original: ma grub sgrub byed min zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: ma grub sgrub byed min zhes bya bas so //
translated: The word already means either by oneself or by the phrase or it is not established as the proof.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: rang gi don zhes zer ba ni de ltar na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi don zhes zer ba ni de ltar na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word own means if it is so, then.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa bzhin du rang nyid 'dod pa ni ni sht'i rkyen nyid kyi 'dod par 'gyur ba'i bsgrub bya nyid sgrub byed nyid du brjod pa sel bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa bzhin du rang nyid 'dod pa ni ni sht'i rkyen nyid kyi 'dod par 'gyur ba'i bsgrub bya nyid sgrub byed nyid du brjod pa sel bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúby one‚Äôs own assertion‚Äù is as follows: Just as the probandum is asserted, the probandum itself is not eliminated as the proof by the condition of the locative case.

original: bstan par bya ba dus gsum gyi don la gtso bo dang 'brel pa'i phyir na shti'i rkyen gyi don la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rang nyid 'dod pa yis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba dus gsum gyi don la gtso bo dang 'brel pa'i phyir na shti'i rkyen gyi don la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rang nyid 'dod pa yis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the locative case is not relied upon because the object of expression is related to the primary meaning of the three times.

original: bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs bstan par bya ba yin zhes bya ba khong nas phyung bas ngag rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs bstan par bya ba yin zhes bya ba khong nas phyung bas ngag rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the statement ‚Äúthe probandum is asserted to be the position of the object of expression‚Äù is extracted from within, the statement is complete.

original: nye bar bstan pa rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is the object of expression not understood?

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ji ltar yin zhes bya ba'i zer ba la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ji ltar yin zhes bya ba'i zer ba la /
translated: How is it that the characteristics are incompatible?

original: 'dod rkyen 'dir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod rkyen 'dir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The locative case is asserted here.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid du bstan bya yin par bstan pa de las ji zhig rtogs par bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid du bstan bya yin par bstan pa de las ji zhig rtogs par bya bar 'gyur /
translated: What is understood from the statement that the object of expression is taught as its own nature?

original: ma brjod pa la ni khong nas dbyung bas 'dod pa ji lta ba bzhin pa'i 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma brjod pa la ni khong nas dbyung bas 'dod pa ji lta ba bzhin pa'i 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And in the case of what is not stated, it is accomplished by implication, so that the desired meaning is accomplished just as desired. This is the meaning of and so on.

original: yang na zhes bya ba'i 'grel ba'o //üîΩyan @248a * //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'i 'grel ba'o // yan @248a * //
translated: Or, and so on is the commentary.

original: lag ni 'bras bu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lag ni 'bras bu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The limb is that which possesses a result.

original: yan lag med pa ni cig shos so //
analyzed: yan lag med pa ni cig shos so //
translated: The devoid of limbs is the opposite.

original: rang nyid ces bya ba 'dod pas yongs su bzung ba'i rjod byed ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba 'dod pas yongs su bzung ba'i rjod byed ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't itself understood as the expression of desire?

original: grub pa'i ngo bo dang bstan bcos su 'dod pa bsgrub bya ma yin pa nyid dag la bstan pa'i rigs pas 'di nyid do zhes bya bar ji ltar nges pa yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: grub pa'i ngo bo dang bstan bcos su 'dod pa bsgrub bya ma yin pa nyid dag la bstan pa'i rigs pas 'di nyid do zhes bya bar ji ltar nges pa yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: How is it ascertained that this is it by the reasoning shown in the treatises regarding the established nature and the thesis to be proven?

original: rjod byed min phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjod byed min phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, Because it is not an expression.

original: thun mong ba'i tshig kyang tshig gzhan las rtogs pa'i khyad par ni gzhan gyi rjod byed nyid ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: thun mong ba'i tshig kyang tshig gzhan las rtogs pa'i khyad par ni gzhan gyi rjod byed nyid ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Even a common word, the specific understanding from another word is not the expression of another.

original: bstan par bya ba dang bdag nyid 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di yang khyad par nyid yin te /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba dang bdag nyid 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di yang khyad par nyid yin te /
translated: This is also a distinction, called ‚Äúthe object of instruction‚Äù and ‚Äúone‚Äôs own desire.‚Äù

original: nag po la sogs pa nye ba la ba lang bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nag po la sogs pa nye ba la ba lang bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is like a cow in proximity to a black one, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'di bstan par bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di bstan par bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the teaching of this object of instruction is

original: bstan bcos kun la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos kun la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in all treatises.

original: de'i 'dod pa ni rgol ba'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa ni rgol ba'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: One‚Äôs own desire is the desire of the opponent.

original: de lta na mi 'dod pa yang 'dod pa dang 'dres par 'dod pa kho na yin la de gnod na ni gtan tshigs 'gal ba dang phyogs la yang des gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de lta na mi 'dod pa yang 'dod pa dang 'dres par 'dod pa kho na yin la de gnod na ni gtan tshigs 'gal ba dang phyogs la yang des gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la /
translated: In that case, even the undesired is asserted to be mixed with the desired, and if that is undermined, the reason is contradictory, and the position is also undermined by that.

original: des na zhes bya ba ste rgol ba 'dod pa tsam bsgrub bya nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ste rgol ba 'dod pa tsam bsgrub bya nyid yin pas so //
translated: Therefore, the opponent‚Äôs mere desire is the object of affirmation.

original: mi 'dod dang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dang don gcig la 'du ba can gyi mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod dang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dang don gcig la 'du ba can gyi mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The undesired is synonymous with the quality of space, and sound is impermanent because it is an aggregation.

original: de lta ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i 'dod pa nyid med na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i 'dod pa nyid med na'o //
translated: Otherwise means if there is no desire to argue.

original: bsgrub bya khas len pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'i bsgrub bya smos pas ma bsal ba'i tshig med na ci las bsal ba sel bar byed pa yin zhes zer ba la khas blangs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya khas len pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'i bsgrub bya smos pas ma bsal ba'i tshig med na ci las bsal ba sel bar byed pa yin zhes zer ba la khas blangs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since the word probandum is mentioned in the position of accepting the probandum, if there is no word that is not excluded, from what is the exclusion made? This is what is meant by acceptance.

original: bsgrub bya'i sgra ni the tshom za ba brjod pa'i phyir grub pa nyid bsal ba ni de ltar ram gzhan du zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i sgra ni the tshom za ba brjod pa'i phyir grub pa nyid bsal ba ni de ltar ram gzhan du zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: The word probandum expresses doubt. The exclusion of what is established is by the intention in that way or otherwise, this is the opinion of the Jaina.

original: 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The commentary is easy to understand.

original: tshad ma ni ngag gis bkag med ces bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: tshad ma ni ngag gis bkag med ces bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't valid cognition said to be not negated by speech?

original: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches grags pas ma bsal ba //
analyzed: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches grags pas ma bsal ba //
translated: Direct perception, inference, and what is accepted by the world are not refuted.

original: zhes bya ba'i phyogs ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la rjes su dpag pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i phyogs ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la rjes su dpag pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is this the position? This is the opinion of the Jaina.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni dus dang yul la sogs pa'i dbye bas yal ga mtha' yas pa can ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni dus dang yul la sogs pa'i dbye bas yal ga mtha' yas pa can ma yin nam /
translated: But isn't inference divided into endless branches by the divisions of time, place, etc.?

original: rnam pa gsum ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: How can it be threefold?

original: de la zhes bya ba ste gsal ba'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ste gsal ba'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum nyid ma yin te /
translated: To this he says therein. It is not threefold by the division of the manifest.

original: 'o na ci zhe na 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang de dang 'dra ba'i dbye bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang de dang 'dra ba'i dbye bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But what is it? It is by the division of effect, nature, and similarity, is what is meant.

original: lung gtso bo yin gyi 'dra ba ni ma yin na yang gnod byed nyid yin na thug pa med par @248b bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lung gtso bo yin gyi 'dra ba ni ma yin na yang gnod byed nyid yin na thug pa med par @248b bstan pa ni /
translated: Although scripture is primary, not similarity, he shows that there is no infinite regress if it is contradictory, saying it is not contradictory.

original: yang dag nges ldan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag nges ldan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is endowed with right ascertainment.

original: 'di gnod nyid du brjod pa ni ma yin te gnod nyid du khas blangs pa ni nges pa'i yul la yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di gnod nyid du brjod pa ni ma yin te gnod nyid du khas blangs pa ni nges pa'i yul la yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is not said to be contradictory, but the acceptance of contradiction is in regard to the object of ascertainment, is what is meant.

original: 'dod pa ni khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni khas blangs pa'o //
translated: Acceptance is the claim.

original: yang dag ces bya ba ni bden pa'i ngag yin pas yid ches zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang dag ces bya ba ni bden pa'i ngag yin pas yid ches zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since right is a true statement, it is connected with trustworthy.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos tshad ma yin pa ni rang gi tshig lta bu'o zhes bstan pa ni rang gi tshig dang ni bstan bcos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos tshad ma yin pa ni rang gi tshig lta bu'o zhes bstan pa ni rang gi tshig dang ni bstan bcos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the treatise is valid like one‚Äôs own words. This is shown by the words ‚Äúone‚Äôs own words‚Äù and ‚Äútreatise.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dag tshad ma nyid du khas mi len na /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dag tshad ma nyid du khas mi len na /
translated: If one does not accept the treatise and one‚Äôs own words as valid,

original: de brjod pa dang de la brten nas dpyod pa dag med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de brjod pa dang de la brten nas dpyod pa dag med par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the expression of them and the analysis based on them would not exist. This is shown by the words ‚Äúhow‚Äù and ‚Äúwhen.‚Äù

original: dper na ngas smras pa thams cad brdzun yin no zhes smras pa'i tshig 'di nyid rang tshad ma nyid ma yin na mi 'byung ba de bzhin du 'das pa dang cig shos kyang yin par bstan pa ni dus gsum zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na ngas smras pa thams cad brdzun yin no zhes smras pa'i tshig 'di nyid rang tshad ma nyid ma yin na mi 'byung ba de bzhin du 'das pa dang cig shos kyang yin par bstan pa ni dus gsum zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example, if the words ‚Äúall that I say is false‚Äù are not themselves valid, then they do not occur. In the same way, the past and the other are shown to be so by the words ‚Äúthe three times.‚Äù

original: brdzun pa nyid kyi tshig kho na dgag pa yin te brkus nas zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nyid ma yin na de brjod kyang 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa nyid kyi tshig kho na dgag pa yin te brkus nas zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nyid ma yin na de brjod kyang 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúfalse‚Äù and ‚Äúonly‚Äù are negated, because even if they are expressed, they are rejected if they are not valid.

original: 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe'am gzhan gyi tshe'o //
analyzed: 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe'am gzhan gyi tshe'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy engagement‚Äù means at that time or at another time.

original: 'on te da ltar yin na 'di zhes bya ba gnyi ga dang 'brel pa'i phyir ci bya zhes bya ba ni ci yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te da ltar yin na 'di zhes bya ba gnyi ga dang 'brel pa'i phyir ci bya zhes bya ba ni ci yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it is the present, then what? Since both are related, what is there to do? Nothing at all.

original: ci las she na 'byung bar 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci las she na 'byung bar 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the point? It is said, ‚Äúin order to arise.‚Äù

original: dzab mkhan zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po med kyang rtsed mo'i ro'i don du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dzab mkhan zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po med kyang rtsed mo'i ro'i don du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The magician, even without an audience, recites the spells for the sake of the pleasure of play.

original: bstan bcos grub pa la ni bstan bcos la brten nas dpyod pa de dang 'gal ba can ni de nyid kyi gnod pa yin par go sla ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan du gnod par byed pa nyid dgag par byed pa'i don du brjod pa yin par bstan pa
analyzed: bstan bcos grub pa la ni bstan bcos la brten nas dpyod pa de dang 'gal ba can ni de nyid kyi gnod pa yin par go sla ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan du gnod par byed pa nyid dgag par byed pa'i don du brjod pa yin par bstan pa
translated: In the case of the treatise, the refutation of the opponent‚Äôs position, based on the treatise, is easily understood to be undermined by the treatise itself. Therefore, the refutation of the opponent‚Äôs position is stated elsewhere for the sake of brevity.

original: ni mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ni mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúin order to show that the same applies to the other two‚Äù is for the sake of showing that the same applies to the other two temporal periods.

original: de'i dpyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi rten nyid kho na la gnod par byed pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin pa'i phyir gnas skabs kyi rten nyid kho na gnod par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yin gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis 'jug pa nyid ni ma yin
analyzed: de'i dpyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi rten nyid kho na la gnod par byed pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin pa'i phyir gnas skabs kyi rten nyid kho na gnod par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yin gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis 'jug pa nyid ni ma yin
translated: It is the basis of the analysis that is refuted, not anything else. Therefore, the basis of the analysis is the reason for the refutation, but it is not the case that the refutation is based on the power of things.

original: no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the interpretation of the Svatantrikas.üîΩThe Prasangikas say that this is understood by the following passage from the Pramanavarttika:

original: de bzhin bstan bcos grags don la //
analyzed: de bzhin bstan bcos grags don la //
translated: ‚ÄúThe treatises are for the sake of fame,

original: de bstan min na spyod pa yang //
analyzed: de bstan min na spyod pa yang //
translated: but if they are not taught, they are useless.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: The Prasangikas say that this is the meaning of the above passage.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa ni gal te bstan bcos med na zhes bya ba'o /üîΩkhas blangs nas de dang 'gal ba la de gnod par byed pa yin te /üîΩdper na gzhal bya'i don can gyi tshad ma rnams med pa yin no zhes bya bas bstan bcos @249a * //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa ni gal te bstan bcos med na zhes bya ba'o / khas blangs nas de dang 'gal ba la de gnod par byed pa yin te / dper na gzhal bya'i don can gyi tshad ma rnams med pa yin no zhes bya bas bstan bcos @249a * //
translated: The Prasangikas say that if the treatises did not exist, the words of the Buddha would be contradicted.üîΩThe Prasangikas say that the example of the treatises and their own words is taught by the following passage from the Pramanavarttika:

original: dang rang gi tshig dag gi mtshungs pa'i dpe yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dang rang gi tshig dag gi mtshungs pa'i dpe yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the objects of valid cognition do not exist,üîΩthe valid cognitions do not exist either.‚Äù

original: des na 'dir 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'dir 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, here it is called ‚Äúthis.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos kyi ngag gis rang gi ngag 'gal ba yin na bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur grang na 'di ni de ltar ma yin par bstan pa ni rang tshig 'gal la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi ngag gis rang gi ngag 'gal ba yin na bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur grang na 'di ni de ltar ma yin par bstan pa ni rang tshig 'gal la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the treatise statement contradicts its own statement, then it would contradict the treatise. But this is not so. The statement ‚Äúits own words are contradictory‚Äù is made.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos dang 'gal ba la'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos dang 'gal ba la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the contradiction with the treatise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ma 'ongs pa na mi bde ba ster ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ma 'ongs pa na mi bde ba ster ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that very reason‚Äù means that it gives unhappiness in the future.

original: gzhan la yang bstan bcos kyis de med pa kho nas de khas mi len pa'i phyir gnod pa ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la de la rten min zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan la yang bstan bcos kyis de med pa kho nas de khas mi len pa'i phyir gnod pa ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la de la rten min zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Someone might say, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it the case that it is not a fault because the treatise does not accept that, since it does not exist?‚Äù In response to that, ‚Äúit is not a basis‚Äù is stated.

original: yod kyang khas blangs pas rang bzhin 'brel pa med pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod kyang khas blangs pas rang bzhin 'brel pa med pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even if it exists, since it is accepted, it is not a fault, because there is no connection with the nature of a fault.

original: dngos po la zhes pa ni chos can la'o //
analyzed: dngos po la zhes pa ni chos can la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to things‚Äù means in regard to the subject.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni khas blangs pa'i rtag pa nyid dang bstan bcos pa'i yang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid grub po zhes zer ba la de dag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni khas blangs pa'i rtag pa nyid dang bstan bcos pa'i yang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid grub po zhes zer ba la de dag ces bya ba ste /
translated: Impermanence is contradictory to permanence accepted by the opponent and to the treatise master, and moreover, because it is related to that, how could impermanence be established?

original: bstan bcos pa'i yang yin na gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan bcos pa'i yang yin na gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is contradictory to the treatise master, what need is there to mention that it is contradictory to others?

original: dam bcas ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dam bcas ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thesis is ‚Äúimpermanent.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa ni byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The inference is ‚Äúbecause it is produced.‚Äù

original: dam bca' ba ni bstan bcos so //
analyzed: dam bca' ba ni bstan bcos so //
translated: The thesis is the treatise.

original: rigs bral ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid la sogs pa don dang 'brel pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs bral ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid la sogs pa don dang 'brel pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reason is divorced from the similar class because being a cause that is related to the meaning of ‚Äúnot produced by an agent‚Äù and so on is not a reason.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba med na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba med na'o //
translated: Otherwise means if there is no relation.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid la rgyu skyon med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid la rgyu skyon med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that not being produced by an agent is faultless?

original: rjes su dpag pa bzhin du lung las nges pa yang tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa bzhin du lung las nges pa yang tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: Just as with inference, so also with scripture, certainty is valid knowledge.

original: don dang 'brel pa med na de med pa nyid the tshom za ba yin par bstan pa ni lung rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dang 'brel pa med na de med pa nyid the tshom za ba yin par bstan pa ni lung rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is no connection with the meaning, then the absence of that is doubted. This is shown by the words ‚Äúthe scriptures.‚Äù

original: tshad ma ma yin pa la 'brel pa yang dag la yod ce na de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de'i phyir na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa la 'brel pa yang dag la yod ce na de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de'i phyir na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is a real connection with invalid cognition, then because it does not occur without that, this is shown by the words ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i khyad par la'o //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i khyad par la'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúan intermediate verse‚Äù refer to a particular opponent.

original: rang gi tshig bzhin du gnod par byed pa rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol nyid yin gyi gzhan du na de nyid rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdgos pa med kyang so sor brjod na ni don gyis go ba la sogs pa yir yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi tshig bzhin du gnod par byed pa rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol nyid yin gyi gzhan du na de nyid rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o // dgos pa med kyang so sor brjod na ni don gyis go ba la sogs pa yir yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Just as with one‚Äôs own words, what is to be refuted is external to inference. Otherwise, it would not be understood. This is shown by the words ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: de ltar min na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar min na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one were to state it individually even without a purpose, then it would be understood by implication and so on. This is shown by the words ‚Äúif it were not so.‚Äù

original: @249b dgos pa dang ldan pa yang rjes su dpag pa gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: @249b dgos pa dang ldan pa yang rjes su dpag pa gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The purpose is also taught to be understood from another inference.

original: logs shes byas pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: logs shes byas pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúand the words‚Äù are stated.

original: logs shig tu byed pa mthong ba las don med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: logs shig tu byed pa mthong ba las don med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is seen to be useless to do it separately.

original: 'brel pa'i dbang du byas pa ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i dbang du byas pa ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: The connection is made clear.

original: rang gi tshig kyang bstan bcos las thal ches pa'am don med pa nyid dag kho na 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: rang gi tshig kyang bstan bcos las thal ches pa'am don med pa nyid dag kho na 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The words of the treatise are either too much or useless, and those are the results.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngag dag la ni bstan bcos la gegs byed pa yin zhing rang gi tshig ni de tsam la'o zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngag dag la ni bstan bcos la gegs byed pa yin zhing rang gi tshig ni de tsam la'o zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The words of the treatise are an obstruction to the earlier and later statements, and the words of the treatise are just that. This is taught by ‚Äúthe words.‚Äù

original: rang gi tshig kyang zhes bya ba tha dad pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang gi tshig kyang zhes bya ba tha dad pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The words are connected to ‚Äúseparate.‚Äù

original: gegs byed pa yang khas blangs pa kho na las ma yin nam /
analyzed: gegs byed pa yang khas blangs pa kho na las ma yin nam /
translated: Obstruction is also accepted, is it not?

original: gnod par byed pa nyid kyis ma yin zhes zer ba ni de yis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa nyid kyis ma yin zhes zer ba ni de yis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The words are not an obstruction because they are harmful. This is taught by ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: rgol bar khas blangs par byas pa gnod byed yin pa'i phyir cig shos med na de nyid kyi ma yin pa'i phyir dngos su ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgol bar khas blangs par byas pa gnod byed yin pa'i phyir cig shos med na de nyid kyi ma yin pa'i phyir dngos su ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because the opponent‚Äôs claim is the refutation, and if the other is not present, it is not that. This is the meaning of ‚Äúnot directly.‚Äù

original: khas blangs pa tsam yang de ma yin pa la yang 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khas blangs pa tsam yang de ma yin pa la yang 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: It is shown that mere claim is also not that:

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúby the person‚Äôs desire.‚Äù

original: rang la grub pa rnams la yang bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir gegs byed pa'am cig shos ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang la grub pa rnams la yang bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir gegs byed pa'am cig shos ma yin nam /
translated: Even in one‚Äôs own system, because of accepting the treatise, is there not an obstruction or the other?

original: ji ltar de med na med par de khas blangs pa'o zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar de med na med par de khas blangs pa'o zhes zer ba la /
translated: How is it that if that is not present, it is claimed that it is not present?

original: lkog gyur dag la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lkog gyur dag la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of the hidden.‚Äù

original: shes pa thams cad dmigs pa med pa nyid la sogs pa ni de rab tu grags pa med na mi 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad dmigs pa med pa nyid la sogs pa ni de rab tu grags pa med na mi 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all cognitions, such as the absence of an object, are not necessarily not present when that is not present.

original: gal te lung gis grub pa la de 'gal ba can du sems pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te lung gis grub pa la de 'gal ba can du sems pa ma yin na /
translated: If one does not think that what is established by scripture is contradictory to that,

original: chang btung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bkag pa me'i zhi ba'i mchod sbyin la ji ltar brtag pa yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: chang btung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bkag pa me'i zhi ba'i mchod sbyin la ji ltar brtag pa yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: But how can one investigate the prohibition one should not drink alcohol in the peace-offering of fire?

original: 'di la brtag pa zhes bya ba ste 'gal ba brjod pa las len pa dang mi 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la brtag pa zhes bya ba ste 'gal ba brjod pa las len pa dang mi 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: Here, investigation is a statement of contradiction, and it is not non-contradictory.

original: khyad par sems pa la dpyod pa bzhin du the tshom dang phyogs snga ma la sogs pa rnams srid pa'i don can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par sems pa la dpyod pa bzhin du the tshom dang phyogs snga ma la sogs pa rnams srid pa'i don can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because doubt, the prior position, and so on, have the meaning of possibility, like the analysis of intention in a specific case.

original: gegs byed pa nyid kho na'i 'thad pa nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'grel bar te /
analyzed: gegs byed pa nyid kho na'i 'thad pa nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'grel bar te /
translated: This is the only tenable obstruction, says the commentary.

original: gal te de lta na 'ga' yang gnod pa ma yin no zhes rjes su brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'ga' yang gnod pa ma yin no zhes rjes su brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If so, then it is not harmful in any way, because it is a repetition.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba brjod pa brtag pa phal cher ni blang ba dang dor ba ma yin pa don med pa bstan bcos kyis gnod pa ma yin pas 'gal ba dang cig shos kyang mi srid pa'i phyir bya ba ma yin pa de la brtags @250a * //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba brjod pa brtag pa phal cher ni blang ba dang dor ba ma yin pa don med pa bstan bcos kyis gnod pa ma yin pas 'gal ba dang cig shos kyang mi srid pa'i phyir bya ba ma yin pa de la brtags @250a * //
translated: Most investigations of the statement of mutual contradiction are not the useless teaching of acceptance and rejection, because they are not harmed by the treatise, and because the contradiction and the other are impossible. Therefore, it is not to be done.

original: pas ci zhig bya zhes zer ba la mthong dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pas ci zhig bya zhes zer ba la mthong dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúIf you see . . .‚Äù

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i dbye ba ni khas blangs pas byas pa'i tha mi dad pa la gnod pa ma yin no zhes zer ba ni gal te yid ches pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i dbye ba ni khas blangs pas byas pa'i tha mi dad pa la gnod pa ma yin no zhes zer ba ni gal te yid ches pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply to the objection that the difference of nature and effect is not established by the opponent‚Äôs admission is: ‚ÄúIf you believe . . .

original: de ltar na ji ltar len thebs pa yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar len thebs pa yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: How is it that you are defeated?‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúHere, the opponent . . .

original: khas blangs pa nyid rang bzhin dang 'bras bu nyid kyis tha dad pa yin par bstan pa ni rang bzhin 'bras bu'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khas blangs pa nyid rang bzhin dang 'bras bu nyid kyis tha dad pa yin par bstan pa ni rang bzhin 'bras bu'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù The reply to the objection that the difference of nature and effect is not established by the opponent‚Äôs admission is: ‚ÄúThe nature and effect . . .

original: sgra don zhes bya ba ni grags pa'o //
analyzed: sgra don zhes bya ba ni grags pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù The meaning of the words is well known.

original: de las te bstan bcos las 'di zhes bya ba ni grags pa'o //
analyzed: de las te bstan bcos las 'di zhes bya ba ni grags pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù and ‚Äúin the treatise‚Äù are well known.

original: gal te bstan bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di la rgol ba'i ni des na gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di la rgol ba'i ni des na gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply to the objection that the treatise is not established is: ‚ÄúIf you say . . .üîΩ‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ni de dang de ma yin pa grub pa'i chos can la yang bstan bcos khas blang par bya ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ni de dang de ma yin pa grub pa'i chos can la yang bstan bcos khas blang par bya ba yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAccepted by others‚Äù means that the treatise is to be accepted as the subject that is established as being neither that nor something else.

original: bstan bcos ni phyi rol la gnod par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: bstan bcos ni phyi rol la gnod par byed pa yin la /
translated: The treatise is a refutation of external objects,üîΩbut the popular view is a refutation of the imagined.

original: grags pa ni brtags pa la yin par bstan pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grags pa ni brtags pa la yin par bstan pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Or‚Äù indicates an alternative.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni brtags pa yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni brtags pa yin na yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú Even‚Äù means even though.

original: phyi rol med pa kho nas gnod pa yin par bstan pa ni nyi tshe ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol med pa kho nas gnod pa yin par bstan pa ni nyi tshe ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Limited‚Äù indicates that the treatise is a refutation only of the nonexistence of external objects.

original: 'di la yang zhes zer ba ni 'on te bstan bcos las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes zer ba ni 'on te bstan bcos las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Even‚Äù refers to ‚Äúeven though the treatise says.

original: gnod bya ma yin pa thams cad du grags pa brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni grags pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnod bya ma yin pa thams cad du grags pa brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni grags pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù ‚Äú Popular‚Äù indicates that the treatise is a refutation of the popular view that is not accepted by the treatise.

original: de'i don dpyad pa la bstan bcos 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i don dpyad pa la bstan bcos 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: The treatise is not the only source for the analysis of the meaning of the scripture.

original: de dang 'gal bas gnod par byed pa'i gnod byed rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don rnams la rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid tsam las byung ba yin pa de'i phyir /üîΩphyi rol nyid dang brtag pa nyid la sogs pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod kyang de las bzlog pa la sgra de'i brjod bya nyid ni 'dod pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang 'gal bas gnod par byed pa'i gnod byed rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don rnams la rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid tsam las byung ba yin pa de'i phyir / phyi rol nyid dang brtag pa nyid la sogs pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod kyang de las bzlog pa la sgra de'i brjod bya nyid ni 'dod pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no inference that contradicts and refutes that, the objects expressed by the words of the desire realm arise merely from the domain of conception.üîΩTherefore, although external reality and the Vedas are refuted by inference, the objects of the words of the desire realm are the opposite of that. They arise from desire.

original: 'jig rten dang rig byed dag la 'jig rten la 'grub pa brtag pa la sogs pa'i don yang yongs su brtag pa la sogs pas de las bzlog pa'i don nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni don rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
