analyzed: 'jig rten dang rig byed dag la 'jig rten la 'grub pa brtag pa la sogs pa'i don yang yongs su brtag pa la sogs pas de las bzlog pa'i don nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni don rnams la zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'gag pa med pa nyid ci las she na rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid tsam rgyu mtshan yin pas 'dod pa las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa nyid ci las she na rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid tsam rgyu mtshan yin pas 'dod pa las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From what is non-obstruction?  From the mere object of conceptualization, because it arises from desire. This is indicated by the words 'of a person's desire'.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod bya @250b nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod bya @250b nyid la'o //
translated: Here, 'of a person's desire' is the content of the word 'desire'.

original: gnod med ngag ni rjes su dgag pas mi gnod pa'i ngag can gyi skye bo yid ches pa yin pa na bstan bcos gnod byed yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnod med ngag ni rjes su dgag pas mi gnod pa'i ngag can gyi skye bo yid ches pa yin pa na bstan bcos gnod byed yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: 'Non-obstruction' is the person who is not obstructed by the subsequent negation. When he is trustworthy, the treatise is non-obstructive. This is the meaning of 'obstructive'.

original: rtog pa can rang bzhin gyi ba lang nyid la sogs pa de nyid brjod pa'i sgra'i brjod bya nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtog pa can rang bzhin gyi ba lang nyid la sogs pa de nyid brjod pa'i sgra'i brjod bya nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas say that the very nature of a cow, etc. is the content of the word that expresses it.

original: 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: 'The content of the word desire' is the content of the word 'desire'.

original: nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba dgag par zhes bya bar rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba dgag par zhes bya bar rjes su 'jug go //
translated: 'Is not able' is negated by the word 'not'.

original: nye bar len pa ni smra ba po'i rgyud la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni smra ba po'i rgyud la gnas pa'o //
translated: 'Apprehension' is located in the continuum of the speaker.

original: 'bras bu ni nyan pa po'i rgyud la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni nyan pa po'i rgyud la gnas pa'o //
translated: The result is the state of the listener.

original: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba nas gzhan du khas len zhe na zhes bya ba'i bar du rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba nas gzhan du khas len zhe na zhes bya ba'i bar du rgol ba'o //
translated: If it is so, up to is accepted as different? is the objection.

original: ma yin te zhes bya bas mtshams bcad nas shes na yang zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dgag pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya bas mtshams bcad nas shes na yang zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dgag pa'o //
translated: Not so, up to even if known is the refutation, having delimited it.

original: khyab pa ni khyab par byed pa ste gsal byed kyi'o //
analyzed: khyab pa ni khyab par byed pa ste gsal byed kyi'o //
translated: The pervasion is the pervader, that of the clarifier.

original: de zhes bya ba ni spyi'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni spyi'o //
translated: That is the general.

original: khyab pa can gyi rtogs pa ci las yin zhe na 'on kyang thog med ces bya ba'o //üîΩtha snyad ni 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: khyab pa can gyi rtogs pa ci las yin zhe na 'on kyang thog med ces bya ba'o // tha snyad ni 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: What is the understanding of the pervader?  But beginningless.

original: ba lang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pa'i ngo bo khyad par du ma byas pa'i chos kyi sgrub byed do //
analyzed: ba lang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pa'i ngo bo khyad par du ma byas pa'i chos kyi sgrub byed do //
translated: Convention is the conceptualization of desire, the proof of the general property, not distinguished by the nature of engagement, such as cow.

original: brda las byung ba'i khyad par ni sgra las byung ba de nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: brda las byung ba'i khyad par ni sgra las byung ba de nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The distinction arising from convention is taught as not being that arising from sound itself,

original: bram ze dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bram ze dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: such as Brahmin.

original: ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni mtshungs pa'i rnam pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni mtshungs pa'i rnam pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What exists is merely a similar aspect.

original: grags pa ni rtogs pas grub pa'o //
analyzed: grags pa ni rtogs pas grub pa'o //
translated: Renown is established by understanding.

original: brjod pa ni slob dpon gyis so //
analyzed: brjod pa ni slob dpon gyis so //
translated: Expression is by the master.

original: chos ni 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: chos ni 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: Dharma is the nature of what is to be expressed by the word desire.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sgra'o //
translated: That is said by the word desire.

original: tha snyad la skyes pa ni zla ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa las so zhes bya ba ni bshad par ro //
analyzed: tha snyad la skyes pa ni zla ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa las so zhes bya ba ni bshad par ro //
translated: Born from convention is from the statement the moon and so on. This is the explanation.

original: grags pa'i sgrar zhes bya ba ni 'grel par ro //
analyzed: grags pa'i sgrar zhes bya ba ni 'grel par ro //
translated: Renown is the word. This is in the commentary.

original: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches grags pas zhes bya bas bstan pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches grags pas zhes bya bas bstan pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not taught by direct perception, inference, and what is renowned,

original: 'o na ci zhe na tha snyad las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na tha snyad las byung ba'o //
translated: but rather by what arises from convention.

original: mngon sum sogs kyis zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi tshad ma'i sgra dang 'gal ba can bzlog nas shes par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: mngon sum sogs kyis zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi tshad ma'i sgra dang 'gal ba can bzlog nas shes par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: Direct perception and so on is to be understood as reversing the contradiction with the external valid cognition. This is the opponent's.

original: de'i phyir gnod pa rnam pa bzhi po 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod pa rnam pa bzhi po 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the four kinds of refutation are valid.

original: 'dod pa las byung ba yin yang snam bu la bum pa'i sgrar ma byas na de'i brjod bya de ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa las byung ba yin yang snam bu la bum pa'i sgrar ma byas na de'i brjod bya de ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: Even though it is derived from desire, if the word pot is not made for cloth, how can that be its referent?

original: de la brten nas byung ba can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la brten nas byung ba can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning is that it is called ‚Äúderived from that.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul la brten nas byung ba can 'dod pas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir /üîΩde las gzhan pa @251a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul la brten nas byung ba can 'dod pas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir / de las gzhan pa @251a * //
translated: Because it is accepted that it is derived from the object of conception, it is engaged.üîΩIt is also suitable for something other than that.

original: la yang rung ba nyid kyis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: la yang rung ba nyid kyis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is also suitable for something other than that.

original: byas dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rnams so //
analyzed: byas dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rnams so //
translated: The created are worldly.

original: ma byas pa rnams ni skyes bus ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa rnams ni skyes bus ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: The uncreated are not created by a person.

original: byas pa ste brdar byas pa rnams dang gzhan rnams so zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa'i'o //
analyzed: byas pa ste brdar byas pa rnams dang gzhan rnams so zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa'i'o //
translated: The created are created by convention and others.

original: rtogs pas sprul pa ni don nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rtogs pas sprul pa ni don nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
translated: Is the object of conception not the nature of the object itself?

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy its very nature‚Äù means that it is not a mere verbal designation.

original: don nyid la zhen pa yin gyi bar ma do ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don nyid la zhen pa yin gyi bar ma do ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is a designation of the very object, not of something in between.

original: lhag par zhen pas rnam pa dang don gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pas rnam pa dang don gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a designation of the object itself, not of something in between, because it is applied to the object in such a way that the form and the object are not distinguished.üîΩTherefore, the words of the Vedas, which are of definitive meaning, are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are of definitive meaning, because they are the source of knowledge of the object itself.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten dang rig byed la nges pa'i don can nyid kyi tshig rnams skyes bu'i blo las byung ba dngos por rung ba nyid ma bkag pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten dang rig byed la nges pa'i don can nyid kyi tshig rnams skyes bu'i blo las byung ba dngos por rung ba nyid ma bkag pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.

original: don tsam nges pa'i don nyid kyis mngon sum yin la ma nges pa'i don can nyid kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba ji ltar gnod byed yin zhes zer ba la grags pa med kyang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'jug pa bzhin du gzhan yang rung ba nyid de las byung bar gyur pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don tsam nges pa'i don nyid kyis mngon sum yin la ma nges pa'i don can nyid kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba ji ltar gnod byed yin zhes zer ba la grags pa med kyang zhes bya ba'o // 'jug pa bzhin du gzhan yang rung ba nyid de las byung bar gyur pa kho na yin te /
translated: The words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they are the source of knowledge of the world.

original: smra ba po'i 'dod pa med pas byung bar gyur ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: smra ba po'i 'dod pa med pas byung bar gyur ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The words of the Vedas are not refuted as being the source of knowledge of the world, because they

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dngos su 'brel pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dngos su 'brel pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means by the direct connection itself.

original: de grub pa nyid ni de'i shes par bya ba nyid de 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de grub pa nyid ni de'i shes par bya ba nyid de 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The establishment of that is the state of being its object of knowledge, the state of being expressible by the word ‚Äúdesire,‚Äù is the meaning.

original: 'grel pa ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: The commentary is clear.

original: 'gar yang zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig la'o //
analyzed: 'gar yang zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnywhere‚Äù means in one part.

original: rtog pa'i yul nyid dngos po'i rung ba nyid yin gyi dngos su ma yin par bstan pa ni dngos rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i yul nyid dngos po'i rung ba nyid yin gyi dngos su ma yin par bstan pa ni dngos rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object of conceptualization is suitable as a thing, but not directly, is shown by ‚Äúthings.‚Äù

original: rtog pa yang 'dod pa las byung ba yin gyi dngos po las ma yin pa bstan pa ni 'dod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa yang 'dod pa las byung ba yin gyi dngos po las ma yin pa bstan pa ni 'dod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Conceptualization also arises from desire, not from a thing, is shown by ‚Äúmere desire.‚Äù

original: rang gi rgyu las byung ba'i 'dod pa ni don yul nyid la ltos bzhin pa yin yang de las byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las byung ba'i 'dod pa ni don yul nyid la ltos bzhin pa yin yang de las byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Desire arising from its own cause, while depending on the mere object, does not arise from that.

original: de bstan pa ni don tsam la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni don tsam la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is shown by ‚Äúmere object.‚Äù

original: don de'i rtog pa dang rtog pa'i mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir 'di bzhin du gzhan yang yin te rtog pa'i yul nyid tsam rgyu mtshan nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don de'i rtog pa dang rtog pa'i mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir 'di bzhin du gzhan yang yin te rtog pa'i yul nyid tsam rgyu mtshan nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: Because the thought of that meaning is the same as the thought of the words, it is like this. And the same is true of other words, because there is no difference in the reason, namely, that the object of thought is merely the cause. The meaning of this is taught by the verse:

original: sgra thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: All words.

original: de lta yang ma yin zhes bya ba gzhan la snang ba yin zhes bya bar bsgyur nas sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin zhes bya ba gzhan la snang ba yin zhes bya bar bsgyur nas sbyar ro //
translated: It is not like that. The meaning is to be supplied as ‚Äúit is an appearance to another.‚Äù

original: me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag la khyi'i sha'i don nyid mngon sum dang @251b 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag la khyi'i sha'i don nyid mngon sum dang @251b 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of dog‚Äôs meat is not contradicted by the direct perception of the words of the statement ‚Äúfire sacrifice, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i rung ba nyid mngon sum yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rung ba nyid mngon sum yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The direct perception of its suitability is taught by the verse:

original: khyi sha zo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyi sha zo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Eat dog‚Äôs meat.

original: gzhan du brda yin no zhes bya ba mi rigs pa yang ma yin te mi shes pa rnams kyis chos la sogs pa rnams la brdar byas pa la mi shes pa la sogs pas brda gzhan du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du brda yin no zhes bya ba mi rigs pa yang ma yin te mi shes pa rnams kyis chos la sogs pa rnams la brdar byas pa la mi shes pa la sogs pas brda gzhan du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not unreasonable to say that it is a convention elsewhere, because it is taught that the convention made by the ignorant with regard to dharma, etc., is not changed to another convention by the ignorant, etc. The word ‚Äúagain‚Äù is used for that purpose.

original: rang bzhin gyis don med pa nyid bstan pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //üîΩkhyab pa'i don can gcig cig la phyi ma'i don du bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis don med pa nyid bstan pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o // khyab pa'i don can gcig cig la phyi ma'i don du bshad pa ni /
translated: The statement that the meaning is essentially nonexistent is ‚Äújust as . . . ‚Äù

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the meaning of the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is to be applied to a single thing is ‚ÄúHere . . . ‚Äù

original: sgra mngon sum pa yin yang don rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa nyid las yin na /
analyzed: sgra mngon sum pa yin yang don rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa nyid las yin na /
translated: Even though the word is directly perceived, the understanding of the meaning is only an inference.

original: ji ltar rung ba nyid rtogs pa'i gnod byed yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar rung ba nyid rtogs pa'i gnod byed yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: How can it be a refutation of the understanding of the proper meaning?

original: yang na de la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na de la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, ‚Äúin that case . . . ‚Äù

original: shes pa gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi don bzhin du'o //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi don bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another cognition‚Äù means as in the case of the direct perception of the meaning.

original: 'on te der zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba la'o //
analyzed: 'on te der zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means in the case of the understanding derived from the word.

original: de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa med na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa med na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would be so‚Äù means that without inference there would be no understanding of the meaning.

original: 'di la yang ni sgra las byung ba la'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang ni sgra las byung ba la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this case‚Äù means in the case of the understanding derived from the word.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba med na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba med na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means if there were no connection with the time of the convention.

original: bshad pa'i rjes su ma 'brang par yang zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba dang 'brel pa'o //üîΩsdang ba la sogs pas gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni grags pa las bzlog par ches skyon can nyid yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rjes su ma 'brang par yang zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba dang 'brel pa'o // sdang ba la sogs pas gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni grags pa las bzlog par ches skyon can nyid yin te /
translated: The phrase even without following the explanation is connected with the phrase the cognition.

original: tshad ma can ma yin pa'i don smra ba po ni ches dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma can ma yin pa'i don smra ba po ni ches dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase even in other ways, such as through hostility, etc., means that it is even more faulty than what is well known, because the one who speaks of a non-existent object is even more inferior.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, means because of being an inference.

original: de ltar na rang rig par smra ba po mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na rang rig par smra ba po mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: Thus, the one who advocates reflexive awareness is said to contradict perception.

original: de la gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: In response to that, the phrase if someone says is stated.

original: de yod na yod pa dang med pa dag ces brjod pa bshad pa ni sgra don gyi 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa dang med pa dag ces brjod pa bshad pa ni sgra don gyi 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the phrase if it exists, it is said to exist and if it does not exist, it is said not to exist is the connection between the word and its meaning.

original: nye bar len pa ni don no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni don no //
translated: The object is the appropriated.

original: sgra ni nye bar blang bya ste 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sgra ni nye bar blang bya ste 'bras bu'o //
translated: The word is the result that is to be appropriated.

original: sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su dpag pa gtso bo ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su dpag pa gtso bo ma yin par bstan to //
translated: The phrase the word, etc. indicates that inference is not primary.

original: 'on te ji ltar zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because it is the effect of ‚Äúhow,‚Äù

original: rgyu nyid 'dod pa dang 'brel pa brjod bya nyid kyi rgyu mtshan de'i rang bzhin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'dod pa dang 'brel pa brjod bya nyid kyi rgyu mtshan de'i rang bzhin par bstan pa ni /
translated: the reason for the statement that the cause itself is related to the object of expression is shown to be its nature.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //üîΩnyer len nyid ces bya ba ni rtags so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o // nyer len nyid ces bya ba ni rtags so //
translated: Therefore is the reason.üîΩThe term ‚Äúappropriation‚Äù is the reason.

original: brjod bya nyid ni bsgrub bya yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod bya nyid ni bsgrub bya yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The object of expression is the probandum. This is the meaning.

original: gang zhig gi zhes bya ba ni don no //
analyzed: gang zhig gi zhes bya ba ni don no //
translated: The word ‚Äúwhose‚Äù is the meaning.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba ni sgra'i'o //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba ni sgra'i'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúof‚Äù is the sound.

original: nye bar len pa dang 'bras bu nyid du ni nye bar len pa nyid kyis dang 'bras bu nyid kyis so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang 'bras bu nyid du ni nye bar len pa nyid kyis dang 'bras bu nyid kyis so //
translated: The appropriation and the effect are the appropriation and the effect.

original: nye bar len pa dang 'bras bu nyid du mi snang ba 'ba' zhig ma @252a * //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang 'bras bu nyid du mi snang ba 'ba' zhig ma @252a * //
translated: It is not only the appropriation and the effect that do not appear.

original: yin te / 'o na ci zhe na nye bar len pa'i shes pa smra ba po'i rgyud la yod pa dang / 'bras bu shes pa nyan pa po'i rgyud la gnas pa yang snang ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yin te / 'o na ci zhe na nye bar len pa'i shes pa smra ba po'i rgyud la yod pa dang / 'bras bu shes pa nyan pa po'i rgyud la gnas pa yang snang ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: What then? The cognition of the appropriation that exists in the continuum of the speaker and the cognition of the effect that exists in the continuum of the hearer also do not appear. This is taught by the statement:

original: gal te don to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te don to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is the object,‚Äù

original: de'i brjod par 'dod pa med kyang phyi rol kho na shes pa gnyis kyi zhen par bya ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de'i brjod par 'dod pa med kyang phyi rol kho na shes pa gnyis kyi zhen par bya ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: then, even though there is no desire to express it, the external object alone is the referent of the two cognitions.

original: 'on te rnam pa de las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa de las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúEven from that aspect,‚Äù

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: then ‚Äúby that‚Äù refers to what was said above, ‚Äúbecause of the absence of a common locus.‚Äù

original: mngon sum la sogs pas grub pa ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pas grub pa ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though it is not established by perception and so on,

original: 'on kyang gzhan pa de ni 'dod pa'i sgra'i rung ba nyid don rnams la ci las yin zhes zer ba la gzhan du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan pa de ni 'dod pa'i sgra'i rung ba nyid don rnams la ci las yin zhes zer ba la gzhan du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: nevertheless, what is the purpose of the other, the mere sound that is desired, in regard to the objects?

original: dgag pas dpe la gtan tshigs khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pas dpe la gtan tshigs khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú In another way‚Äù means that the example is not pervaded by the reason, because of the negation.

original: sgrub pa nyid yod pa'i phyir de yod pa ma yin te phyogs gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub pa nyid yod pa'i phyir de yod pa ma yin te phyogs gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the case that it exists, because the proof itself exists. The meaning is that it is only a part.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung bas grub pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung bas grub pa'i'o //
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù refers to the one established by verbal testimony.

original: de skad du zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de skad du zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'o //
translated: The phrase in this way means that there is no inference that can contradict [the Buddha's word] because [the Buddha's word] is unique.üîΩSince there is no contradiction, it cannot be contradicted. For this very reason, the Buddha's word is not a source of valid knowledge.

original: gnod par byed pa med pas gnod par mi nus pa de nyid kyi phyir sgra las byung ba nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bas gnyi ga las kyang phyi ma gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba ni de skad du zhes bya ba'i khyad par
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pas gnod par mi nus pa de nyid kyi phyir sgra las byung ba nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bas gnyi ga las kyang phyi ma gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba ni de skad du zhes bya ba'i khyad par
translated: The phrase in this way means that the latter [i.e., the Buddha's word] is more important than the former [i.e., perception].

original: lhur len pa'i dbye ba las so zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: lhur len pa'i dbye ba las so zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: The phrase from the point of view of the division of the emphasis refers to the Jains.

original: gnod par byed pa med pa nyid kyis gnod bya nyid ma yin /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa nyid kyis gnod bya nyid ma yin /
translated: The phrase because there is no contradiction means that [the Buddha's word] is not contradicted.

original: nges pa ni sgra las byung ba zhes bya ba de nyid kyis yin par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa ni sgra las byung ba zhes bya ba de nyid kyis yin par bshad pa ni /
translated: The phrase because of this very fact explains that [the Buddha's word] is a source of valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma med par ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgcig gis gcig gi sgrub na gzhan rjod par byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tshad ma med par ni zhes bya ba'o // gcig gis gcig gi sgrub na gzhan rjod par byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase without a means of valid knowledge means that [the Buddha's word] is not a means of valid knowledge.üîΩThe phrase one by one shows that [the Buddha's word] is a means of valid knowledge.

original: phyi ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase the latter means that [the Buddha's word] is a means of valid knowledge.

original: sgra las byung ba ni gnod bya nyid dang nges par byed la ma yin pa nyid kyang rjes su dpag pa las yin te /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba ni gnod bya nyid dang nges par byed la ma yin pa nyid kyang rjes su dpag pa las yin te /
translated: That which arises from words is the object to be refuted, and that it is not a determiner is also inferred.

original: mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pas mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pas mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it is not the object of direct perception, it is impossible. This is taught by

original: de 'gog ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'gog ces bya ba'o //
translated: refuting that.

original: rang rig pa'i nye bar mtshon pa zer ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i nye bar mtshon pa zer ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The illustration of self-awareness is said to be if.

original: zhen par bya ba ni rang rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhen par bya ba ni rang rig pa ma yin te /
translated: What is to be clung to is not self-awareness,

original: phyi rol yin no zhes zer ba ni thun mong ma yin par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol yin no zhes zer ba ni thun mong ma yin par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but is said to be external. Not shared is said.

original: dbang po'i mngon sum nyid rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i mngon sum nyid rung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not suitable to be a sense direct perception.

original: rtog pa gcig gi yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa gcig gi yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is the object of a single conception. This is taught by not...

original: yul yin pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni rung ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul yin pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni rung ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The clarification of being an object is suitability.

original: sgra las byung bas @252b grub pa'i don sgra'i don nyid du nges pa ni /
analyzed: sgra las byung bas @252b grub pa'i don sgra'i don nyid du nges pa ni /
translated: The ascertainment of the meaning established by that which arises from words as the meaning of the words is

original: snang ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: connected with appearance.

original: snang ba'i sgra dang 'brel pa can nam zhes bya ba ni gal te zhes bya bar 'brel te /
analyzed: snang ba'i sgra dang 'brel pa can nam zhes bya ba ni gal te zhes bya bar 'brel te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin connection with the sound that is perceived‚Äù is connected to the phrase ‚Äúif it were the case.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa ni 'brel pa dang rung ba nyid kyang dgag par bya ba ni mdon sum la rung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni 'brel pa dang rung ba nyid kyang dgag par bya ba ni mdon sum la rung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Connection‚Äù means being connected and being suitable. The point of the refutation is that it is not suitable to be connected.

original: des na 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa rung ba nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: des na 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa rung ba nyid kyang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore, this‚Äù refers to the connection being suitable.

original: rung ba nyid dgag pa la rjes su dpag pa thams cad thun mong ma yin no zhes brjod par 'dod pas lus pa la khyab pa'i yod pa nyid kyang thun mong ma yin pa ni phyogs kyi skyon la yang brjod par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rung ba nyid dgag pa la rjes su dpag pa thams cad thun mong ma yin no zhes brjod par 'dod pas lus pa la khyab pa'i yod pa nyid kyang thun mong ma yin pa ni phyogs kyi skyon la yang brjod par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since it is asserted that the negation of suitability is not common to all inferences, the remaining pervasion is taught to be a fault of the position:

original: gang la yod nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la yod nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú If it exists in that, it is not suitable.‚Äù

original: gnod par byed pa yod pa la ltos pa ni dngos su ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yod pa la ltos pa ni dngos su ba ma yin la /
translated: The existence of the object of refutation does not depend on the existence of the refutation.

original: dngos su ba yin pa ni rang nyid gnod byed yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dngos su ba yin pa ni rang nyid gnod byed yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Since the refutation itself is the refuter, the text says:

original: sgra las byung ba'i grags pa 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i grags pa 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú This is the well-known meaning that arises from the words.‚Äù

original: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir dgag par mi nus pa yin pa de'i phyir ma nges pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir dgag par mi nus pa yin pa de'i phyir ma nges pa yang yin te /
translated: Because there is no refutation, it is also indeterminate.

original: sgra las byung bas grub pa nyid kyis thams cad du grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni sgra ni brda la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra las byung bas grub pa nyid kyis thams cad du grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni sgra ni brda la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is established by verbal testimony, it is established in all cases. This is indicated by the words ‚Äúsound is a conventional symbol.‚Äù

original: mi 'grub min zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la gegs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'grub min zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la gegs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not unestablished‚Äù means that there is no impediment to the assertion.

original: de ltar na dgag par mi nus pa nyid kyis gnod par byed ba med pas nges par nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na dgag par mi nus pa nyid kyis gnod par byed ba med pas nges par nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because it is not possible to refute it by the fact that it cannot be refuted, it is possible to ascertain it.

original: rjes su dpag pa thams cad la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba mi srid par brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa thams cad la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba mi srid par brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is shown that it is said that it is impossible for there to be a nonerroneous contradiction in all inferences: ‚ÄúBy inference.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i ni dgag par mi nus pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ni dgag par mi nus pa la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù refers to the fact that it cannot be refuted and so forth.

original: grags pa la de ltar brjod kyi rjes su dpag pa la ni /
analyzed: grags pa la de ltar brjod kyi rjes su dpag pa la ni /
translated: This is said with regard to what is well known, not with regard to inference.

original: ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúIs it not so?‚Äù

original: grags pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grags pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWell known‚Äù means that it is well known in the world.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin te sgrub par byed par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin te sgrub par byed par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to something else, and ‚Äúestablishes‚Äù is supplied.

original: rtogs par mi nus pa ni dmigs par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par mi nus pa ni dmigs par mi nus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCannot be ascertained‚Äù means cannot be perceived.

original: gcig la zhes bya ba ni dngos po la'o //
analyzed: gcig la zhes bya ba ni dngos po la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn one‚Äù means in a thing.

original: the tshom za ba yod na ston pa yin pa'i phyir dgos pa bstan pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom za ba yod na ston pa yin pa'i phyir dgos pa bstan pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since there is doubt, the purpose is stated: ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

original: mngon du byas pa thams cad la tshad ma gzhan gnod par byed pa gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni mngon du byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon du byas pa thams cad la tshad ma gzhan gnod par byed pa gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni mngon du byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is shown that there is no other valid cognition that contradicts all that is perceived: ‚ÄúAll that is perceived . . .‚Äù

original: thams cad ni 'khrul pa yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad ni 'khrul pa yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means all that is mistaken.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum la 'brel pa kho na tshad ma nyid kyis rgyu mtshan yin par bstan pa ni de 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum la 'brel pa kho na tshad ma nyid kyis rgyu mtshan yin par bstan pa ni de 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that the only reason for valid cognition is the connection with direct perception: ‚ÄúThat is this . . .‚Äù

original: rgyun gyis don byed par dmigs nas de dang 'dra ba la de nyid do zhes nges @253a * //
analyzed: rgyun gyis don byed par dmigs nas de dang 'dra ba la de nyid do zhes nges @253a * //
translated: Having observed the functioning of a continuum, one ascertains that what is similar to it is the same.

original: par byed pa'i mngon sum ni 'jug par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: par byed pa'i mngon sum ni 'jug par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt direct perception that which engages?

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don byed pa dang de'i rung ba nyid 'di'i yul ma yin no zhes zer ba la mi slu ba de yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don byed pa dang de'i rung ba nyid 'di'i yul ma yin no zhes zer ba la mi slu ba de yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That nondeception is alsoüîΩ.

original: thob pa ni snang bzhin pa kho na yin gyi de'i ngo bo la 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thob pa ni snang bzhin pa kho na yin gyi de'i ngo bo la 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Obtainment is only the appearance of the object, it is not the engagement with the object's nature.

original: mi snang ba'i don gyi ngo bo la ni don gyi snang ba'i rung ba nyid rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pas rtogs pa ni goms na mthong ba kho na las de 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i don gyi ngo bo la ni don gyi snang ba'i rung ba nyid rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pas rtogs pa ni goms na mthong ba kho na las de 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The suitability of the appearance of the object to the object's nature that is not apparent is understood through the process of inference.

original: yang na rjes su dpag pa med na sgra las byung bas grub pa gnod byed yin pa de lta bur rtogs pas sgra las byung ba rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na rjes su dpag pa med na sgra las byung bas grub pa gnod byed yin pa de lta bur rtogs pas sgra las byung ba rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, if there is no inference, then the establishment of the object by means of verbal testimony is undermined.

original: gnod byed kyi yang gnod byed ni rjes su dpag pa yin par brjod pas shugs kyis rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can med par gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnod byed kyi yang gnod byed ni rjes su dpag pa yin par brjod pas shugs kyis rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can med par gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The refutation of refutation is inference, and so it is indirectly stated that there is no nonerroneous contradiction of the object of inference.üîΩ The meaning of this is that it is impossible to refute the opponent's position, and so the words having a well-known meaning cannot be given another interpretation.

original: de ni 'di ltar dgag par mi nus pa nyid kyis grags pa'i don can gyi tshig rnams don gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gnod par byed pa nyid ni bzlog pa'i tshad ma med pa nyid dang / nges pa med pas kyang sgra las byung ba sgrub pa la gnod par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar dgag par mi nus pa nyid kyis grags pa'i don can gyi tshig rnams don gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gnod par byed pa nyid ni bzlog pa'i tshad ma med pa nyid dang / nges pa med pas kyang sgra las byung ba sgrub pa la gnod par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: The refutation is also a refutation because it is not established by valid cognition, because there is no valid cognition that refutes it, and because there is no certainty, and so it is a refutation of the establishment of the Vedas from words.

original: 'gal ba med pas rjes su dpag pa nges pa'i don can yin pa nyid kyis rig byed la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pas rjes su dpag pa nges pa'i don can yin pa nyid kyis rig byed la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no contradiction, inference has a definite meaning, and so it is not the same as the Vedas, etc.

original: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba lhag par bstan pas mngon sum la sogs pa'i phan yon gsum bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba lhag par bstan pas mngon sum la sogs pa'i phan yon gsum bstan to //
translated: The phrase such as indicates the three benefits of perception, etc.

original: de bzhin du mi mthun pa med pa nyid kyis sam gzhan las kyang rtogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi mthun pa med pa nyid kyis sam gzhan las kyang rtogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Likewise, it is not understood from anything else, because there is no disagreement.

original: 'brel pa'i stobs las byung ba gnod do zhes bya ba cir 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i stobs las byung ba gnod do zhes bya ba cir 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: What is the point of saying that it arises from the power of the relation?

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung bas grub pa la rjes su dpag pa med pa rtogs par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung bas grub pa la rjes su dpag pa med pa rtogs par byed pa la'o //
translated: Here means in the proof by the power of the statement that inference does not prove what is already established.

original: stobs chung ba la stobs su brjod pa ni gzhan mtshon par byed do zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: stobs chung ba la stobs su brjod pa ni gzhan mtshon par byed do zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not right to say that the weak is called powerful in order to indicate another.

original: 'di nyid 'dod pa yod pas stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'dod pa yod pas stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that it is powerful because it is desired,

original: gal te 'dod tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dod tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is merely desired.

original: dbyig pas snum khur bshad pa ni byi ba rnams kyis dbyig pa khyer ba'i tshul gyis te /
analyzed: dbyig pas snum khur bshad pa ni byi ba rnams kyis dbyig pa khyer ba'i tshul gyis te /
translated: The explanation of the oil-seller with the stick is like the way mice carry sticks.

original: lan ni snum khur smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lan ni snum khur smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya'o //
translated: The reply is, what need is there to mention the oil-seller?

original: sgra las byung ba 'dod pa 'byung ba yin pa la gnod par byed pa yod na dngos po byung ba la /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba 'dod pa 'byung ba yin pa la gnod par byed pa yod na dngos po byung ba la /
translated: If there is an impairment of the desire that arises from sound, then the entity that arises is impaired.üîΩ

original: lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni snum khur dang dbyig pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni snum khur dang dbyig pa'i tshul lo //

original: de spangs pas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa spangs pa ste /

analyzed: len pa bzhin du 'dor ba yang thob par sla ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no time when it is empty of that‚Äù means that because it is established as different, the words ‚Äúnot produced‚Äù or the memory is suitable to be applied to what is suitable to be applied, because it is asserted to be non-deceptive.üîΩThere is no inference that proves that.
