translated: When it is taught by ‚Äúin any‚Äù and so on, at that time, the object-universal of those is taught for the purpose of teaching the division of the object.üîΩThe teaching is ‚Äúby that.‚Äù

original: bya ba'o // de yang dngos po las byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bya ba'o // de yang dngos po las byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: That is not produced from a thing.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: brjod par 'dod pas byung ba de'i phyir rig byed rnams la don gyi nges pa med par bstan pa ni des ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pas byung ba de'i phyir rig byed rnams la don gyi nges pa med par bstan pa ni des ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is produced by the desire to express. Therefore, the teaching that the meaning of the Vedas is not ascertained is ‚Äúby that.‚Äù

original: de'i dbang ni dngos po'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: de'i dbang ni dngos po'i dbang ngo //
translated: The power of that is the power of the thing.

original: de'i 'dod las skyes na skyes bu'i 'dod pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dod las skyes na skyes bu'i 'dod pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: If it arises from the desire of a person, it arises from the desire of a person.

original: gzhan dag ni drug pa dang tshig gi dbye ba la sogs pa ni dngos su ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni drug pa dang tshig gi dbye ba la sogs pa ni dngos su ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the sixth case, the division into words, etc. are direct.üîΩIf all are not direct, what is the use of the distinction? This is the view of the Jains.

original: thams cad dngos su ba nyid ma yin na khyad par gyis ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: thams cad dngos su ba nyid ma yin na khyad par gyis ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: The following is stated to refute that:

original: dngos rnams yod med pa'i @254a * //
analyzed: dngos rnams yod med pa'i @254a * //
translated: It follows that things are neither existent nor non-existent.

original: rjes su 'jug can zhes bya ba ni 'di bzlog bya bstan pa ni rjes su dpag par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug can zhes bya ba ni 'di bzlog bya bstan pa ni rjes su dpag par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who follows this refers to the one who is to be refuted. Inference refers to the teaching.

original: gzhan las mi 'gyur bas tshogs pa yod na ma dmigs pa ni 'bras bu yin gyi brjod bya rjod par byed pa ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las mi 'gyur bas tshogs pa yod na ma dmigs pa ni 'bras bu yin gyi brjod bya rjod par byed pa ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: Since it does not occur from another, when the collection exists, non-apprehension is the effect, but the expression and the expresser are not like that,

original: 'dod pa tsam gyis byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba'o //üîΩsngar zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam gyis byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba'o // sngar zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
translated: because they are made by mere desire. This is taught by That is true, but...üîΩPreviously refers to knowledge.

original: ngas sngar zhes bya ba ni rtog pa ste /
analyzed: ngas sngar zhes bya ba ni rtog pa ste /
translated: I previously refers to conception.

original: 'bras bu nyid rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa brjod bya nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa brjod bya nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The result itself is not the meaning of the word, along with the reason.

original: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa med na yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa med na yang ngo //
translated: Even so means even if there is no indication.

original: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni ma bor na'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni ma bor na'o //
translated: Otherwise means if there is no omission.

original: rgan po'i tha snyad las kyang 'brel pa can nyid du shes pa kho na yin gyi 'brel pa'i shes pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gal te ming dang ming can dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgan po'i tha snyad las kyang 'brel pa can nyid du shes pa kho na yin gyi 'brel pa'i shes pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gal te ming dang ming can dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is understood that the old convention is related, not that it is known to be related.

original: gzhan yang rung te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rung te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or something else means such things as the result.

original: mthar gnas ni ya dang ra dang la dang wa rnams so //
analyzed: mthar gnas ni ya dang ra dang la dang wa rnams so //
translated: The long vowels are ya, ra, la, and va.

original: ring po gang gi dbyangs kyi dang por ring ba de ni ring ba yin la /
analyzed: ring po gang gi dbyangs kyi dang por ring ba de ni ring ba yin la /
translated: That which is long is long, the first vowel of which is long.

original: de ma yin pa ni thung ba'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa ni thung ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is short.

original: dgra bo la med pa ni dgra bo la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bo la med pa ni dgra bo la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Not in the enemy means not in the enemy.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus na 'di ni shing rtog pa na sa'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ma shes pas mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus na 'di ni shing rtog pa na sa'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ma shes pas mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because at the time of the convention, one does not know the connection, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is a chariot.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin pa bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin pa bsal ba yin te /
translated: This eliminates the essentialist.

original: thal ches pa yin pas brda la ltos pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal ches pa yin pas brda la ltos pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absurdity of the consequence that the convention would not depend on the words.

original: sgra de'i brjod bya nyid kho na de las kyang shes pa'i phyir ro zhes brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sgra de'i brjod bya nyid kho na de las kyang shes pa'i phyir ro zhes brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not imagine that the meaning of the word is the object of the word, because the word is the cause of the cognition of the meaning.

original: rgan po rang nyid kyi rtog pa la ni su zhig la yang rang dbang med de /
analyzed: rgan po rang nyid kyi rtog pa la ni su zhig la yang rang dbang med de /
translated: No one has any control over the words of an old man.

original: skyes bus ma byas ba'i phyir skyon med pa'i don dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba dgos pa 'grub pa'i nges pa yin no zhes zer ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas ba'i phyir skyon med pa'i don dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba dgos pa 'grub pa'i nges pa yin no zhes zer ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the word is not created by a person, so there is no fault. The meaning of the word is connected to the object, and the purpose is accomplished. This is the certainty.

original: rgan pos brtags pa las don gzhan rang gis rtogs par bya ba la mngon sum la sogs pa'i rtsa ba med na /
analyzed: rgan pos brtags pa las don gzhan rang gis rtogs par bya ba la mngon sum la sogs pa'i rtsa ba med na /
translated: If the meaning of the word is not the object of the word, and if the meaning is to be understood by itself, apart from the word, then there is no basis for direct perception, etc.

original: rgan po brgyud pa mi shes pa'i rtsa ba can yin pas ji ltar 'di skyon med pa'i shes pa yin zhes bstan pa ni gal te don ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgan po brgyud pa mi shes pa'i rtsa ba can yin pas ji ltar 'di skyon med pa'i shes pa yin zhes bstan pa ni gal te don ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since the root of the old age of the lineage is ignorance, it is shown that this is a faultless cognition.

original: rtsa ba med pa ni skyon kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa ni skyon kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúif the object‚Äù is that the rootless is only a fault.

original: rtog pa 'di skyes bus byas pa yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du gzhan yang 'di bzhin du yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa 'di skyes bus byas pa yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du gzhan yang 'di bzhin du yin te /
translated: Just as this conception is created by a person, so too is the other like this.

original: gzhan du ba nyid la tshad ma med par bstan pa ni don 'di yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ba nyid la tshad ma med par bstan pa ni don 'di yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that there is no valid cognition in the case of otherness is ‚Äúthis meaning also.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyis ni rtogs par byed pa las so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni rtogs par byed pa las so //
translated: By that very thing, it is understood.

original: gzhan @254b yang zhes bya ba ni thams cad gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan @254b yang zhes bya ba ni thams cad gzigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other‚Äù is the all-seeing one.

original: de zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the thing.

original: bshad pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni de gzigs pa la'o //
analyzed: bshad pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni de gzigs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the use of explanation?‚Äù is in regard to seeing that.

original: ri bong can zla ba ma yin zhes bya ba de ltar smra ba la zla ba nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan pa gal te ri bong can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ri bong can zla ba ma yin zhes bya ba de ltar smra ba la zla ba nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan pa gal te ri bong can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement The rabbit-bearer is not the moon is a statement that the moon is not established. The verse that proves that the moon is the rabbit-bearer is If the rabbit-bearer....

original: 'di ni grags pa'i brjod bya bzhin zhes bya ba ni bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni grags pa'i brjod bya bzhin zhes bya ba ni bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the well-known expression vase, etc.

original: zla bar rtogs pa bzhin du bum pa la sogs par rtogs pa de la med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni ri bong can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zla bar rtogs pa bzhin du bum pa la sogs par rtogs pa de la med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni ri bong can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement The rabbit-bearer... shows that the cognition of the moon and the cognition of the vase, etc. are non-existent.

original: 'dod pa'i sgra brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir don rnams la zla ba ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgra brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir don rnams la zla ba ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the inference that objects are not the moon because they are the referents of the desired sound not uncommon?

original: de nyid kyi phyir zla ba nyid ma grub pa la bum pa la sogs pa la ji ltar thun mong ma yin pa ma yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zla ba nyid ma grub pa la bum pa la sogs pa la ji ltar thun mong ma yin pa ma yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: For that very reason, how can the vase, etc. be uncommon when the moon itself is not established?

original: ri bong can zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi ste /
analyzed: ri bong can zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi ste /
translated: The statement The rabbit-bearer... is the reply.

original: rtog pa thams cad spong bar byed pa la dpe med pa yin gyi 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod bya nyid smra pa po la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad spong bar byed pa la dpe med pa yin gyi 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod bya nyid smra pa po la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the speaker who speaks of the meaning of the term ‚Äúdesire‚Äù as an example of the abandonment of all conceptualization.

original: gzhan du na shing sha pa ni shing ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du na shing sha pa ni shing ma yin te /
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible to say, ‚ÄúA ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is not a tree,

original: yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod pa mi srid pa'i phyir 'di gnod byed du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod pa mi srid pa'i phyir 'di gnod byed du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because it exists,‚Äù and so on.

original: da ltar ni seng sdeng la sogs pa la yang shing ma yin par khas len pa'i phyir brjod pa srid pa la gnod byed yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ltar ni seng sdeng la sogs pa la yang shing ma yin par khas len pa'i phyir brjod pa srid pa la gnod byed yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, since even a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree and so on are accepted as not being a tree, it is taught that it is possible to say that it is a refutation.

original: dpe 'di nyid ces bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: dpe 'di nyid ces bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: This very example,

original: de spong bar mi byed pa nyid la zla ba gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid ma yin te dha tri shing ma yin zhes bya ba yang des khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de spong bar mi byed pa nyid la zla ba gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid ma yin te dha tri shing ma yin zhes bya ba yang des khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the case that it is not that very thing, since it is the very same moon, and because it is accepted that a dhatri is not a tree.

original: 'grel pa ni gsal lo //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni gsal lo //
translated: The commentary is clear.

original: brjod pa la srid pas gcig kyang gcig mang po yin pa'i phyir khyab pa yin pas gcig tu sbyor bar byed pa yin par bstan pa ni bsgrub bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa la srid pas gcig kyang gcig mang po yin pa'i phyir khyab pa yin pas gcig tu sbyor bar byed pa yin par bstan pa ni bsgrub bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is possible to express it, it is pervaded by being many, since one is one of many. The word ‚Äúprobandum‚Äù shows that it is applied to one.

original: yang na zla ba nyid la yang yod pa nyid thun mong ma yin pa ma yin par bstan pa ni 'dir yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zla ba nyid la yang yod pa nyid thun mong ma yin pa ma yin par bstan pa ni 'dir yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúhere‚Äù shows that existence is not uncommon even to the moon.

original: rtogs pa thams cad spong ba la gal te thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin na de smra ba po la yang cis mi 'gyur zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rtogs pa thams cad spong ba la gal te thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin na de smra ba po la yang cis mi 'gyur zhes zer ba la /
translated: If it is uncommon to the exclusion of all understanding, why is it not so for the speaker?

original: brda las zhes bya ba ste 'dod pa tsam las byung ba zla ba nyid kho na 'am brda las byung ba yin te thams cad du byung ba'i phyir 'dis ni zla ba ma yin pa nyid thun mong ma yin pan yid du brjod pa yin no //üîΩzla ba nyid ma yin na bum pa la sogs @255a * //
analyzed: brda las zhes bya ba ste 'dod pa tsam las byung ba zla ba nyid kho na 'am brda las byung ba yin te thams cad du byung ba'i phyir 'dis ni zla ba ma yin pa nyid thun mong ma yin pan yid du brjod pa yin no // zla ba nyid ma yin na bum pa la sogs @255a * //
translated: It is said: ‚Äúfrom convention.‚Äù It is from mere desire, or it is from convention, since it occurs everywhere. This expresses the uncommon non-moonness.

original: yong pas khyab pa ma yin na /
analyzed: yong pas khyab pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is not the moon, it is not pervaded by being a pot, etc.

original: de'i shes pa la de bden pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba la gal te la lar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i shes pa la de bden pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba la gal te la lar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In regard to the cognition of that, it is said, ‚ÄúThat is true only.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa spong ba po'i yang zla ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs pa spong ba po'i yang zla ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: It is not even the moon of the one who rejects the realization.

original: la lar zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: la lar zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In some cases‚Äù means in a pot, etc.

original: dngos stobs las yin zhes bya ba ni de yang ri bong can la zla ba nyid de nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos stobs las yin zhes bya ba ni de yang ri bong can la zla ba nyid de nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚Äú By the power of fact‚Äù means that the moon itself is established as the rabbit-bearer.

original: ci las she na grags pas grub pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci las she na grags pas grub pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: From what? ‚Äú By what is established by common sense.‚Äù

original: grags pas grub pa zla ba nyid ma yin pa bum pa la sogs pa khas len na ri bong can ma yin pa zla ba nyid ma bkag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: grags pas grub pa zla ba nyid ma yin pa bum pa la sogs pa khas len na ri bong can ma yin pa zla ba nyid ma bkag pa'i phyir te /
translated: If one accepts that a pot, etc. is not the moon, which is established by common sense, then the non-rabbit-bearer is not refuted as not being the moon.

original: rigs pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: rigs pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: ‚Äú Because there is no difference in the reasoning‚Äù is the argument of the Jaina.

original: la lar ni dngul la sogs pa la zla ba nyid du gal te grub na nges pa'i yul can yin pas dngos su ba kho na yin na des grub pa dngos su ba ma yin pa'am de dgag pa yang ji ltar yin /
analyzed: la lar ni dngul la sogs pa la zla ba nyid du gal te grub na nges pa'i yul can yin pas dngos su ba kho na yin na des grub pa dngos su ba ma yin pa'am de dgag pa yang ji ltar yin /
translated: In some cases, if silver and so on are established as the moon, then since the object is ascertained, it is directly established. But how could it be established by that which is not directly established, or even by its negation?

original: 'on te grags pas grub pa'i phyir dngos su ba ma yin na grags par khyad par med pa'i phyir ri bod can la yang bkag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'brel par ro //
analyzed: 'on te grags pas grub pa'i phyir dngos su ba ma yin na grags par khyad par med pa'i phyir ri bod can la yang bkag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'brel par ro //
translated: But if it is not directly established because it is established by what is renowned, then since there is no difference in what is renowned, it is not refuted even in the case of the rabbit-bearer.üîΩThis is the connection.

original: gal te kha cig kho nar te ri bong can zla ba nyid yin gyi dngul la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te kha cig kho nar te ri bong can zla ba nyid yin gyi dngul la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is only in some cases, then the rabbit-bearer is the moon, not silver and so on.

original: de lta yin na nges pa'i yul can dngos su ba dgag par ma yin la grags pas grub pa ma yin pa ma nges pa'i yul can yin pas ri bong can ma yin pa dngul la sogs pa la yang ji lta thun mong ma yin zhes bya ba
analyzed: de lta yin na nges pa'i yul can dngos su ba dgag par ma yin la grags pas grub pa ma yin pa ma nges pa'i yul can yin pas ri bong can ma yin pa dngul la sogs pa la yang ji lta thun mong ma yin zhes bya ba
translated: If that is so, then the object of ascertainment is not directly established, nor is it established by what is renowned. Since it is an object of non-ascertainment, how could it be non-common even in silver and so on, which are not the rabbit-bearer?

original: ni 'grel par ro //
analyzed: ni 'grel par ro //
translated: This is in the commentary.

original: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa la zla ba ma yin pa nyid grags pas /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa la zla ba ma yin pa nyid grags pas /
translated: Just as it is well known that a pot, etc. are not the moon,

original: grub pa dngos su pa yin pa /
analyzed: grub pa dngos su pa yin pa /
translated: and that is established by the force of fact,

original: de bzhin du ri bong can la yang zla ba nyid yin par bstan pa ni de ni dngos stobs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ri bong can la yang zla ba nyid yin par bstan pa ni de ni dngos stobs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: in the same way, it is taught that the rabbit-bearer is the moon. That is called ‚Äúthe force of fact.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni zla ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni zla ba nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the moon.

original: dngos po la ste rtsa 'di ni tshim par byed pa'o zhes bya bas zla ba nyid de la 'jug par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan med na ri bong can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po la ste rtsa 'di ni tshim par byed pa'o zhes bya bas zla ba nyid de la 'jug par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan med na ri bong can ma yin pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú In fact‚Äù means that this is satisfying. Thus, it is taught that there is no reason for engaging in the moon in that way. The rabbit-bearer is not

original: bum pa la sogs pa la zla ba nyid bzlog kyang ngo //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la zla ba nyid bzlog kyang ngo //
translated: the moon, even though the moon is excluded from a pot, etc.

original: 'grel pa ni gsal lo //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni gsal lo //
translated: The commentary is clear.

original: de ltar na bum pa la sogs pa la su zhig gis bzlog pas skyon yin par bstan pa ni de phyir zhes bya ba la'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bum pa la sogs pa la su zhig gis bzlog pas skyon yin par bstan pa ni de phyir zhes bya ba la'o //
translated: Thus, it is taught that since the moon is excluded from a pot, etc. by someone, that is the fault. ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù refers to that.

original: 'grel par dang po'i gnas skabs na yang 'di dang 'brel pa ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi gnas skabs nye bar bsdu ba 'brel par dka' ba yin pa'i lan bstan pa ni rung ba nyid des zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'grel par dang po'i gnas skabs na yang 'di dang 'brel pa ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi gnas skabs nye bar bsdu ba 'brel par dka' ba yin pa'i lan bstan pa ni rung ba nyid des zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the commentary, the reply to the question, ‚ÄúHow can there be a connection with this [universal] even in the initial state, since it is difficult to connect it with the state of being a unique particular?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is tenable because of that.‚Äù

original: rung ba nyid kyang rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa ma yin nam @255b zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyang rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa ma yin nam @255b zhes zer ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBut isn‚Äôt the universal also a reason?‚Äù

original: gal te sgra thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sgra thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll words are . . .‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan med kyang rgyu mtshan la 'jug par mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med kyang rgyu mtshan la 'jug par mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúBut isn‚Äôt it seen that even without a reason, one engages in a reason?‚Äù

original: de bzhin du de dang ldan pa yang 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du de dang ldan pa yang 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the same way, it would also have that .‚Äù

original: sgra rnams 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra rnams 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe engagement of words . . .‚Äù

original: khyab par byed pa ma yin ba mi srid par bstan pa ni rgyu mtshan la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ma yin ba mi srid par bstan pa ni rgyu mtshan la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration that it is impossible for there to be no pervader is ‚ÄúEven in the case of a reason . . .‚Äù

original: dngos su ba'i 'brel pa med pa thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis ma yin par bstan pa ni gal te la lar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos su ba'i 'brel pa med pa thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis ma yin par bstan pa ni gal te la lar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration that it is not the case that there is no direct connection with the universal because of being a unique particular is ‚ÄúIf it is the case that in some cases . . .‚Äù

original: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: Also means having a reason.

original: ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra 'dod pa las byung ba ni da ltar ram dus gzhan du dran pa yin no zhes zer ba ni 'dod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra 'dod pa las byung ba ni da ltar ram dus gzhan du dran pa yin no zhes zer ba ni 'dod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The desire to say the sound of a cow, etc. is the desire to say the sound of a cow, etc. in the present or another time.

original: ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The answer is because it is not perceived.

original: 'das pa'i 'dod pa yod kyang gang las kyang ma dmigs pa'i phyir dran pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'dod pa yod kyang gang las kyang ma dmigs pa'i phyir dran pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even though the desire of the past exists, it is not remembered because it is not perceived anywhere.

original: rgyu mtshan yod kyang ji ltar rgyu mtshan med pa yin zhes zer ba sel ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yod kyang ji ltar rgyu mtshan med pa yin zhes zer ba sel ba ni /
translated: How can there be a reason when there is no reason? To eliminate this doubt, it is said:

original: gzhan dag smra ba ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag smra ba ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The other's statement is:

original: rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa nyid yi rgyu mtshan la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa nyid yi rgyu mtshan la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the reason that has the reason, but the one that has the reason.

original: yang na dngos po'i sgra gzhan ma yin par bstan pan i rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dngos po'i sgra gzhan ma yin par bstan pan i rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, the word thing is not different, so it is called concomitant.

original: rgyu mtshan yin na rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa dngos po rkyen yin yang ji ltar brjod bya yin du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yin na rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa dngos po rkyen yin yang ji ltar brjod bya yin du sems pa ni /
translated: If it is a reason, then why is it called a condition of a thing that has a reason?

original: ni ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ni ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúnamely.‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan la 'jug pa ni de dang ldan pa 'brel pa yod na 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan la 'jug pa ni de dang ldan pa 'brel pa yod na 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The engagement of the reason is shown by the existence of the connection with that.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúwhen.‚Äù

original: dngos po'i rkyen gyis sgra tha dad pa yin gyi don tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen gyis sgra tha dad pa yin gyi don tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The difference in sound is due to the condition of the thing, but not to a difference in meaning. This is shown by

original: dngos po'i rkyen med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúwithout the condition of the thing.‚ÄùüîΩThe exclusion of the condition of the thing by the word ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù is shown by

original: rkyen thams cad ni zhes bya bas dngos po'i rkyen gyi mtha' can la khyad par med pa rdzas kyi sgras sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen thams cad ni zhes bya bas dngos po'i rkyen gyi mtha' can la khyad par med pa rdzas kyi sgras sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúall conditions‚Äù and ‚Äúwithout distinction.‚ÄùüîΩThe difference in the reason that has a reason is shown by the word ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù as the reason, and similarly by the word ‚Äúthing‚Äù as the distinction. This is shown by

original: rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par ni rdzas kyi sgra la rgyu mtshan yin la de bzhin du dngos po'i sgra la yang khyad par yin pa'i phyir tha dad par bstan pa ni rdzas la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par ni rdzas kyi sgra la rgyu mtshan yin la de bzhin du dngos po'i sgra la yang khyad par yin pa'i phyir tha dad par bstan pa ni rdzas la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe engagement of substance.‚Äù

original: dngos po'i mtha' can gyi sgra gzhan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' can gyi sgra gzhan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not another word that has a thing as its referent,üîΩbecause that is another word.

original: de ni sgra gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas nyi bar mtshon pa kho na yin par bshad pa ni /üîΩrang bzhin dang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrim gyis sam cig shos kyi rnam pas kyang rgyu mtshan yin par bstan pa ni de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni sgra gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas nyi bar mtshon pa kho na yin par bshad pa ni / rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba'o // rim gyis sam cig shos kyi rnam pas kyang rgyu mtshan yin par bstan pa ni de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúnature‚Äù explains that it is only a metaphor.üîΩThe word ‚Äúotherwise‚Äù teaches that it is a reason in the order or in the reverse order.

original: des rnam par bcad pa nyid ma rtogs par bstan pa ni @256a * //
analyzed: des rnam par bcad pa nyid ma rtogs par bstan pa ni @256a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúif‚Äù teaches that it is not understood as an exclusion.

original: des na rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúreason‚Äù teaches that.

original: rgyu mtshan dang ldan par rtogs pa de gtso bor dang cig shos la sogs pa yang 'dod pa las byung ba yin par bstan pa ni gtso bo phal pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang ldan par rtogs pa de gtso bor dang cig shos la sogs pa yang 'dod pa las byung ba yin par bstan pa ni gtso bo phal pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúprimary‚Äù teaches that the understanding that possesses a reason is primary, and that the other, etc., are derived from desire.

original: sbrang rtsi ni rdzas de grags tsam gyi 'dod pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi ni rdzas de grags tsam gyi 'dod pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Honey is derived from desire for that substance, which is merely renowned.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù is the answer.

original: bya rog la sogs pa gang yin pa dang rigs la sogs pa gang yin pa yang rdzas kyi rjod byed de nyid las mtshon pas ni bya rog la sogs pas so //
analyzed: bya rog la sogs pa gang yin pa dang rigs la sogs pa gang yin pa yang rdzas kyi rjod byed de nyid las mtshon pas ni bya rog la sogs pas so //
translated: The word etc. includes crows and so on, and the word kind includes kinds and so on. The expression by means of that which expresses substance means by means of crows and so on.

original: mtshon par gyur pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pas so //
analyzed: mtshon par gyur pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pas so //
translated: The expression not by means of that which is expressed means not by means of kinds and so on.

original: des zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gyis so //üîΩrgyu mtshan med kyang goms pas 'jug pa yin na thams cad la 'jug pa yin par bstan pa ni de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gyis so // rgyu mtshan med kyang goms pas 'jug pa yin na thams cad la 'jug pa yin par bstan pa ni de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression by that means by means of a reason.üîΩIf one engages in something through habituation even without a reason, then the following verse is stated: In that case, why does one not engage in all things?

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan med kyang 'jug pa yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan med kyang 'jug pa yin na'o //
translated: If one engages in something even without a reason, then the following verse is stated: If one engages in something even without a reason, then why does one not engage in all things?

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis grags pa ni gang na yod par mi 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni khyi sha la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis grags pa ni gang na yod par mi 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni khyi sha la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression even in dog meat teaches that renown does not exist by the power of human desire.

original: nyes pa dang ldan pa 'ga' yang ldog pa ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyes pa dang ldan pa 'ga' yang ldog pa ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The expression no one would refrain from anything that is faulty is supplied.

original: 'dod pa las byung ba'i chos kyi rung ba nyid bzhin du de dgag pa'i rung ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'dod pa las byung ba'i chos kyi rung ba nyid bzhin du de dgag pa'i rung ba nyid yin na /
translated: Just as there is a fitness for the occurrence of something that arises from desire, so there is a fitness for the occurrence of its negation.

original: ji ltar de dang 'gal ba yin //
analyzed: ji ltar de dang 'gal ba yin //
translated: How can there be a contradiction between them?

original: zhes zer ba la rung ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes zer ba la rung ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The fitness for the occurrence of something is called its ‚Äúpossibility.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa las byung ba rtogs pa'i go bya ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa las byung ba rtogs pa'i go bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúit‚Äù refers to the object of understanding that arises from desire.

original: de'i go bya bkag na de ma yin pa'i go byar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i go bya bkag na de ma yin pa'i go byar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when its understanding is negated, it does not become the object of a different understanding.

original: brda skad bkag pa med pa las byung ba'i rung ba nyid rjes su dpag pa'i yul gang yin pa de ste /
analyzed: brda skad bkag pa med pa las byung ba'i rung ba nyid rjes su dpag pa'i yul gang yin pa de ste /
translated: The fitness for the occurrence of something that arises from the absence of the negation of a conventional expression is the object of inference.

original: de las bzlog pa de dang 'gal ba ma yin pa la 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa de dang 'gal ba ma yin pa la 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the case that the negation of that is a contradiction of it.

original: don rnams sgra thams cad kyi rung ba nyid du brjod pas sgra yang don thams cad kyi rung ba nyid du brjod par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni sgra rnams la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don rnams sgra thams cad kyi rung ba nyid du brjod pas sgra yang don thams cad kyi rung ba nyid du brjod par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni sgra rnams la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúall words are fit for all meanings‚Äù shows that words are fit for all meanings.

original: der zhes bya ba ni nges pa yod pa ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni nges pa yod pa ma yin pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù means in the absence of any certainty.

original: 'gog pa ni 'jig rten la don gang dag la grags pa'i tshig rnams srid pa yin na de don dang ldan pa nyid yin gyi don gzhan dang ldan ba ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni 'jig rten la don gang dag la grags pa'i tshig rnams srid pa yin na de don dang ldan pa nyid yin gyi don gzhan dang ldan ba ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRefutation‚Äù means that the words that are well known in the world are possible, but they are not related to that meaning, but to another meaning.

original: ma yin te 'dir gzhan du zhes bya ba ni byed pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te 'dir gzhan du zhes bya ba ni byed pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNo, because here . . . is established‚Äù means that the other is established.

original: der brtag pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: der brtag pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe reason for the investigation there‚Äù means the validity.

original: yang na 'jig rten smra nyid la //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten smra nyid la //
translated: Or else, in the world, speech itself

original: rjes dpag med pa brjod pa ci //
analyzed: rjes dpag med pa brjod pa ci //
translated: is stated without inference.

original: zhes bya ba de la yang rtsa ba ni khyad par med pa'i don rnams sgra'i rung ba nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la yang rtsa ba ni khyad par med pa'i don rnams sgra'i rung ba nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Here, the root text teaches that the meaning of the words is not distinguished, but is only suitable:

original: des ni @256b rgyu mtshan can sgra'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des ni @256b rgyu mtshan can sgra'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe reason for the words . . . ‚Äù

original: rung ba nyid la sgra'i brda ni de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pas sprul pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba nyid la sgra'i brda ni de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pas sprul pa'o //
translated: The convention of the words is imagined by the conception that this is just that.

original: skyes bu re zhing brda'am brjod pa re re nyid la'am /
analyzed: skyes bu re zhing brda'am brjod pa re re nyid la'am /
translated: For each person, each word or expression is the first to be used,

original: 'gro ba'i dang por byed pa'am //üîΩgcig po su yis cig car yin //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dang por byed pa'am // gcig po su yis cig car yin //
translated: or the first of beings,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas yin na //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas yin na //
translated: or the only one, by whom was it used at once?

original: ji ltar gsal bar bya ba yin //üîΩzhes zer ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar gsal bar bya ba yin // zhes zer ba la /
translated: How can it be made clear?

original: dpyod pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said: By analysis.

original: de las ni dpyod pa la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: de las ni dpyod pa la sogs pa las so //
translated: From that, from analysis and so on.

original: grags pa ni brda las byung ba'i gnod pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: grags pa ni brda las byung ba'i gnod pa mi rigs te /
translated: It is unreasonable to fault it as being merely conventional,

original: yon tan dang 'phel ba nyid la sogs pa bzhin du nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan dang 'phel ba nyid la sogs pa bzhin du nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is capable, like qualities, increase, and so on.

original: brda las rung ba nyid kyi yul can gyi rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin la /
analyzed: brda las rung ba nyid kyi yul can gyi rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin la /
translated: Understanding with a conventional object is inference,

original: yongs su bshad pa pa'i yul du tha dad par brjod pa gzhan du nges pa'i yul can yin pa de yang 'gyur bar srid par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su bshad pa pa'i yul du tha dad par brjod pa gzhan du nges pa'i yul can yin pa de yang 'gyur bar srid par bstan pa ni /
translated: and it is possible to teach that it has a different object than the one fully explained, as it has a different object.

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said: Therefore,

original: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos bzhin du'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos bzhin du'o //
translated: like before, like one's own words and treatises.

original: grags pa spong ba ni don dam pa pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: grags pa spong ba ni don dam pa pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Abandoning fame is not ultimate.üîΩThe intention is that the acceptance of one's treatise as valid is undermined by it, and the acceptability derived from convention is undermined by what is renowned.

original: rang gi bstan bcos tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa la des gnod pa dang brda las byung ba'i rung ba nyid la gnod par grags pas gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa ni tha dad par byed pa po yin gyi gzhan ma yin zhes bya
analyzed: rang gi bstan bcos tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa la des gnod pa dang brda las byung ba'i rung ba nyid la gnod par grags pas gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa ni tha dad par byed pa po yin gyi gzhan ma yin zhes bya
translated: The intention is that the agent is distinct, not otherwise.

original: bar ji ltar rtogs pa yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: bar ji ltar rtogs pa yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: How is it understood?

original: grub pa tha dad ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: grub pa tha dad ces bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, Established as distinct.

original: rjes su dpag pa smos pas de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa smos pas de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the character of that, by mentioning inference.

original: tha dad par bshad pa'i dogs pa nyid yin par shes par byed pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad par bshad pa'i dogs pa nyid yin par shes par byed pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the doubt that it is distinct is understood.

original: dam bca' ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dam bca' ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, By the mere thesis.

original: gtan tshigs brjod pas so /
analyzed: gtan tshigs brjod pas so /
translated: By stating the reason.

original: brjod pa tsam gyis rjod byed dang brjod bya dag gam snga ma dang / phyi ma'i brjod bya dag 'gal pa yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis kyang don thams cad du srid pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa tsam gyis rjod byed dang brjod bya dag gam snga ma dang / phyi ma'i brjod bya dag 'gal pa yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis kyang don thams cad du srid pa nyid yin te /
translated: Because the mere expression contradicts the expressed meaning, or the former and latter expressed meanings, it is also a unique refuting inference, which is possible in all cases.

original: 'dod pa las byung ba nyid kyis mi gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa las byung ba nyid kyis mi gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: Because it is not refuted by arising from what is desired, this is the position of the Jains.

original: tha dad par byed par yul gyi dbye ba ston pa yin la /
analyzed: tha dad par byed par yul gyi dbye ba ston pa yin la /
translated: It shows the division of objects that are differentiated.

original: gtan tshigs dang bcas pa nyid kyis ni de'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang bcas pa nyid kyis ni de'i khyad par ro //
translated: By having a reason, it is its distinction.

original: de yang lhag pa las khyad par tsam rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang lhag pa las khyad par tsam rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because only a distinction is understood from the remainder,

original: de lta ma yin te gal te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yin zhes bsam par bya ba'o //üîΩrgyas pa las cig shos dgos pa gang gi yin pa'i tshig de gang @257a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yin zhes bsam par bya ba'o // rgyas pa las cig shos dgos pa gang gi yin pa'i tshig de gang @257a * //
translated: it is not so. If it were so, it would be as follows. This is to be contemplated as to how it is.

original: dag gi yin pa de dag go //
analyzed: dag gi yin pa de dag go //
translated: From the extensive, the other is necessary. Whose words are they? Those of them.

original: ri bo 'bigs byed kyi nang na gnas pa ni drang srong bya da'i'o //
analyzed: ri bo 'bigs byed kyi nang na gnas pa ni drang srong bya da'i'o //
translated: The sage VyƒÅsa dwells in the Vindhya mountains.

original: mi bzad pa ni mi bzad pa can nyid do //
analyzed: mi bzad pa ni mi bzad pa can nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúUnbearable‚Äù means having unbearable suffering.

original: shar ba ni mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam ches che bar son pa'o //
analyzed: shar ba ni mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam ches che bar son pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRising‚Äù means having reached the highest path of heaven and liberation.

original: de nyid mtho ba'i ri bo yin te thams cad las 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid mtho ba'i ri bo yin te thams cad las 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the high mountain, because it is superior to all.

original: lam gol ba ni dman pa rnams kyi lam te lam ngan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lam gol ba ni dman pa rnams kyi lam te lam ngan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe wrong path‚Äù is the path of the inferior, not the bad path.

original: nub par ni nu pa ri la ste nyams pa ni nub pa'o //
analyzed: nub par ni nu pa ri la ste nyams pa ni nub pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSetting‚Äù is in the west, and ‚Äúdecline‚Äù is setting.

original: 'od zer ni rnams nyid phyag ste /
analyzed: 'od zer ni rnams nyid phyag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúRays‚Äù are hands.

original: des 'bras bu med pa'i rtsom pa ni shar la sogs pa ste de mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: des 'bras bu med pa'i rtsom pa ni shar la sogs pa ste de mi srid pa'o //
translated: By that, the beginning of fruitless action is in the east, and so on, and that is impossible.

original: yang na aa ste bya sta'i sgra ni 'chol bar te /
analyzed: yang na aa ste bya sta'i sgra ni 'chol bar te /
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúas‚Äù is a particle.

original: ma brngas par rul pa'i rtsva lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma brngas par rul pa'i rtsva lta bu'o //
translated: It is like uncut rotten grass.

original: tshig rkang bzhi pa 'di ni rgyal ba can gyis sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig rkang bzhi pa 'di ni rgyal ba can gyis sbyar ba yin no //
translated: This fourth verse is composed by Jina.

original: ji ltar grags pa ni sgra'i yul du rung ba'i yul can ni rang gi yul bkag par byed pa de bzhin du mngon sum yang gzhan la ma yin par bstan pa ni mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar grags pa ni sgra'i yul du rung ba'i yul can ni rang gi yul bkag par byed pa de bzhin du mngon sum yang gzhan la ma yin par bstan pa ni mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as what is renowned is the object of the domain of sound, the object of the domain is refuted by itself. In the same way, direct perception is also taught to be not other than that. ‚ÄúBy direct perception‚Äù means

original: du ma'i dngos nyid du zhes bya ba ni brjod bya byed nyid kyi spyi'i khyad par la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du'o //
analyzed: du ma'i dngos nyid du zhes bya ba ni brjod bya byed nyid kyi spyi'i khyad par la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the nature of many things‚Äù means by the nature of the general and specific entities of the expressed and the expresser.

original: grags pa'i ni rtog pa'i yul gyi'o //
analyzed: grags pa'i ni rtog pa'i yul gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRenowned‚Äù means the object of thought.

original: mnyan la zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: mnyan la zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i shes pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHeard‚Äù means the auditory consciousness.

original: ngo bo nyid gang zhig ni brjod bya rjod byed la sogs pa gnyis dang bral ba de'i ngo bor snang ba nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir de la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin na phyogs ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba rjes su 'jug pa yin
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang zhig ni brjod bya rjod byed la sogs pa gnyis dang bral ba de'i ngo bor snang ba nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir de la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin na phyogs ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba rjes su 'jug pa yin
translated: If the nature of something is free from the duality of the expressed and the expresser, etc., since the experience of the appearance of that nature does not exist, direct perception contradicts it. If it is said that it is not so, then it is not so.

original: gyi / rjod byed ma yin pa la sogs pa gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gyi / rjod byed ma yin pa la sogs pa gzhan ma yin te /
translated: It is not something else, such as not being the expresser.

original: de la mngon sum nyid mi 'jug pas rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mngon sum nyid mi 'jug pas rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because inference does not apply to that, since perception does not apply to it.

original: de nyid spong na mngon sum gyis gnod 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ba yin gyi 'brel pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid spong na mngon sum gyis gnod 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ba yin gyi 'brel pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif you deny that, you contradict perception‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: rna ba'i dbang pos gzhung bar bya ba nyid ni sgra mnyan par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang pos gzhung bar bya ba nyid ni sgra mnyan par bya ba yin la /
translated: The object of the auditory faculty is sound, which is heard.

original: de'i 'di yin pa'am de las byung ba ni snang ba yin pa'i phyir mnyan par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i 'di yin pa'am de las byung ba ni snang ba yin pa'i phyir mnyan par bya ba yin la /
translated: That is the appearance, or it arises from that, so it is heard.

original: de ma yin zhes bya bar bsgrub par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ma yin zhes bya bar bsgrub par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration of the proof that it is not that is as follows.

original: 'o na ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is it?

original: sngon po ni de las gzhan pa las sngon po ma yin pa las bzhin du log pa nyid mngon sum pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon po ni de las gzhan pa las sngon po ma yin pa las bzhin du log pa nyid mngon sum pa yin te /
translated: Blue is the opposite of that, like the non-blue.

original: rtogs pa ma rtogs par zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ma rtogs par zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif it is not understood‚Äù means ‚Äúif it does not appear.‚Äù

original: mnyan par bya ba ma yin pa'i dpe 'ba' zhig las don 'di ma yin gyi mdo las kyang yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba ma yin pa'i dpe 'ba' zhig las don 'di ma yin gyi mdo las kyang yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: This meaning is not only indicated by the example of the object that is not heard, but also by the sutra.

original: de don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is the meaning.

original: don bshad ces bya ba ni @257b mngon sum don zhes bya ba la'o //
analyzed: don bshad ces bya ba ni @257b mngon sum don zhes bya ba la'o //
translated: The explanation of the meaning is in the phrase ‚Äúdirect perception is the meaning.‚Äù

original: brjod par bya ba nyid dang spyi la sogs pa yang mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i yul la rtogs pa'i go bya ni dngos po kho na ma yin nam zhes zer ba la //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba nyid dang spyi la sogs pa yang mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i yul la rtogs pa'i go bya ni dngos po kho na ma yin nam zhes zer ba la //
translated: But is not the object of understanding, which is the object of seeing by direct perception, only a thing, such as the expressible, the universal, and so on?

original: de nyid de dang de las log pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rtog pa ni nyid dran par byed pa yin par bstan pa ni lhag ma zhes bya ba'o //üîΩldog pa'i ngo bo yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid de dang de las log pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rtog pa ni nyid dran par byed pa yin par bstan pa ni lhag ma zhes bya ba'o // ldog pa'i ngo bo yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe remainder‚Äù teaches that the conceptual thought that is the reason for the exclusion of that from this is the reminder.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe universal is the nature of a non-thing‚Äù teaches that it is not a thing because it is the nature of an exclusion.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit is not a non-thing‚Äù teaches that it is not a non-thing because it is the nature of a thing.

analyzed: rtog pa med par rtogs pas gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po yang 'dzin pa ma yin na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not a non-thing‚Äù teaches that it is not a non-thing because it is the nature of a thing.üîΩThe phrase

analyzed: rtog pa gcig pu'i go bya la ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa ches ma yin par bstan pa ni /

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //

original: gnyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don bstan pa ni /

analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: sngon po'i mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni sngon po la yin pa las bzhin du sngon po gzhan las kyang yin na /

analyzed: gzhan dag las ldog pa ni ba lang ma yin pa las so //
